data.name: Dlg_Test01
data.value: This is a test. Chunky bacon!

data.name: Dlg_Test02
data.value: Yes! Chunky bacon for everyone!

data.name: Dlg_Test03
data.value: This is a very long text. You know, just to test loading times of long sounds. It goes on and on, it just won’t stop! I can’t take it anymore!

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0200
data.value: Military alert. Unreported Russian mother ships approaching.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0201
data.value: What the hell?

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0202
data.value: Emergency. Evacuate the mines.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0203
data.value: We are under heavy attack. Enemies in superior numbers.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0204
data.value: Two mother ships with cruiser missiles stationed on periphery.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0205
data.value: Forty-six fighters inside the station.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0206
data.value: Still feeling bored, little brother?

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0207
data.value: Time to give that military education of mine a workout! Let’s kick some zhopa!

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0208
data.value: Calm down. First we need to get outside and get the situation report.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0209
data.value: Heavy civilian casualties. Evacuate station. Use the nearest exit or escape pod.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0210
data.value: Military, follow Protocol 1-1-9. Take whatever actions necessary to protect civilians.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0211
data.value: Captain, we are ready to help secure the situation.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0212
data.value: Two Arion MK7 Fighters, both pilots with advanced Greenbelt training.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0213
data.value: Marcus Rainier, do not engage enemy directly.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0214
data.value: Make your way out alive. We will oppose the Russian forces only if…

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0215
data.value: God, what’s going on?!

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0216
data.value: We need to get to the command center.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0217
data.value: Check out the situation and send a distress signal.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0301
data.value: They just destroyed two civilian ships!

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0302
data.value: Just keep moving.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0401
data.value: Cave-in. Help me blast it apart with missiles!

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0501
data.value: We need to follow this airway…

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0602
data.value: My God! Those ships are gargantuan!

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0603
data.value: Looks like they’re about to turn this station into gravel.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0604
data.value: Why…? This is a civilian operation! What are they thinking?!

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0701
data.value: Madelyn, do you copy?

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0702
data.value: Marcus! What’s going on over there?

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0703
data.value: This is serious. Our survey site is under attack. Heavy casualties. Enemy unknown.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0704
data.value: Madelyn, we need you to get us out of here.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0705
data.value: Go to the hangar 1 and wait there.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0709
data.value: Madelyn, we’ll be at the meeting point on time. Just… try to hurry.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0710
data.value: I just received a distress call.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0801
data.value: Get ready for pickup!

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0802
data.value: Ready for a ride, Apollo?

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0803
data.value: Yes, let’s get out of here!

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0901
data.value: Damn, the whole command center is offline.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0902
data.value: The generators are fried. I can’t believe this is happening!

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0903
data.value: Let’s head to the basement and try to fire up the emergency power unit.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0904
data.value: Affirmative.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_1001
data.value: It should work now. Fingers crossed.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_1002
data.value: Looks like it worked – the automated vendor next door is online again.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_1003
data.value: Well, we could use some more supplies.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0218
data.value: Roger. Confirmed.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0502
data.value: …to the other side of the base to get to the command center.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0503
data.value: I hope this is the right decision!

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0601
data.value: Outside! Look!

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_1201
data.value: What now? We can’t hide here forever.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_1202
data.value: Trust me. There are soldiers protecting us.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_1203
data.value: They should be here soon.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_1204
data.value: There seem to be some friends alive.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_1305
data.value: The place is ready to blow.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_1306
data.value: –fluid than that.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_1307
data.value: Wha-what? We are dead!

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_1301
data.value: I knew you hadn’t abandoned us!

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_1302
data.value: Are the enemies eliminated? Is the area secure now?

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_1303
data.value: Secure? Negative. The situation is a bit more–

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_1304
data.value: We’ve had massive casualties. The enemy crushed our defenses.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_1401
data.value: …secure the data from all research facilities…

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_1501
data.value: …prepare missile barrage…

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_1601
data.value: …Remember to keep no one alive. This mission is classified…

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_1701
data.value: General, we have secured 17 hostages in upper satellite wing. Orders?

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_1702
data.value: …Kill them. Leave no witnesses…

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_1801
data.value: …send encoded transmission to L-K. We found…

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0605
data.value: Hurry up, we need to get to the other side! Pronto!

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_1308
data.value: Take it easy. Just follow us, we’ll make it through.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_1309
data.value: At your back, sir. Lead the way!

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_2101
data.value: Madelyn better be here!

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_2102
data.value: You can never find a cab when you need one!

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_2201
data.value: General, we found no indications of the presence of the artifact…

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_2301
data.value: …the artifact is not… ?

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_2401
data.value: …two miners escaped?…

data.name: Dlg_FortValiant_SlaveMission_01_TemplarGuard
data.value: You have received two new missions available from solar map.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0100
data.value: We have to find out exactly where the signal came from and gather all the data we can.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0504
data.value: I’ve sent you coordinates of the two satellites.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0102
data.value: I suggest checking the computers and communication arrays.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0103
data.value: Apollo, I installed a hacking tool on your ship.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0104
data.value: Use it to extract the data from the digital devices.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0200
data.value: Hmm, why so many military ships just for a customs check?

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0201
data.value: That does seems odd. Be ready for anything.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0202
data.value: Keep moving.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0303
data.value: I’ll be around in case you need a quick withdrawal.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0300
data.value: This wasn’t so hard.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0500
data.value: Nothing.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0501
data.value: No record of communication with the assault squad on Landswick.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0502
data.value: What now?

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0503
data.value: I scanned all the communication arrays and computers on Laika.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0600
data.value: Let’s start with the one toward the west.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0601
data.value: It should be easier to get to from here.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0602
data.value: Confirmed.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0700
data.value: Good news, bad news.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0701
data.value: Good news, I’ve retrieved something.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0702
data.value: Bad news, it seems that all outgoing messages are split between the two satellites.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0800
data.value: Success!

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0801
data.value: I have the rest of the recordings and some other data on the operation at New Landswick.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0802
data.value: Great. Let’s get back to Madelyn

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0803
data.value: Roger that.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0804
data.value: I have some bad news for you, guys.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0806
data.value: The cavalry has arrived.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0900
data.value: Looks like they have some pretty nasty nuclear warheads stored here.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0105
data.value: Rogger that.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0106
data.value: Try not to attract much attention. The longer they stay uninterested in us, the better.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0304
data.value: As long as there are no enemy mother ships…

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0305
data.value: Okay, good. But first we need to get what we came for.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0307
data.value: Though it might bring us more trouble than we bargained for.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0308
data.value: The command center is marked on your GPS.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0309
data.value: Go there and check for any datalogs of outgoing and incoming transmissions.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0310
data.value: Did you notice that strange equipment those fighters were using?

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0311
data.value: I don’t believe this is Russian military we’re facing.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0312
data.value: Neither do I.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0313
data.value: I made some preliminary scans of the ships.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0314
data.value: According to the database, some of their equipment and ship models…

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0505
data.value: Check them out, up close, maybe they store the data directly there.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0703
data.value: Some kind of security hash.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0704
data.value: But you wouldn’t believe what I’ve got so far, guys.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0705
data.value: Off to the second satellite now.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0706
data.value: …So don’t keep me in suspense. What did you find out so far?

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0707
data.value: I was planning to save story-time for later, but here, listen to this.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0708
data.value: …We found no information about the alien artifacts in Landswick.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0709
data.value: Mr. Vasilyev will not be pleased as to the other findings.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0710
data.value: Also, two miners escaped.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0711
data.value: However, they pose no real threat. And they do not know what is going on.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0712
data.value: We will make sure the politburo sends…

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0713
data.value: Our contacts at EAC will see to it that those two miners are persecuted and distrusted.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0714
data.value: Finish your work and get back to L-K for de-briefing.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0715
data.value: That’s all.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0716
data.value: I have more data, but it’s impossible to decode without the second transmitter.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0717
data.value: Holy crap, guys. What’s going on?

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0718
data.value: Alien artifacts? Either it’s code for something or…

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0719
data.value: …or those Russians believe humankind is not alone in this universe.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0720
data.value: Whether they’re right or not…

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0721
data.value: According to that transmission, we’re in big trouble.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0722
data.value: Save the chit-chat for later, girls.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0723
data.value: My scans show incoming Russian mother ships; same ones we met before.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0724
data.value: Hurry up, in just a few minutes we’ll be outmuscled, big-time.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0807
data.value: Right over the corner – two Russian mother ships from Landswick.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0808
data.value: I suggest we do-si-do.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0809
data.value: What about those nuclear warheads we saw? What if we…

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1501
data.value: Two Arion MK7 Fighters to Laika. Request permission for landing.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1502
data.value: Please proceed to landing bay 1 for customs and cargo scan.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1503
data.value: Copy. Proceeding to your coordinates.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1504
data.value: Just… be careful. You never know.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1505
data.value: We are always careful. Right, Apollo?

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1506
data.value: Um, sure.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1601
data.value: Red guards – you have your orders. Fire!

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1602
data.value: Damn it!

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1603
data.value: Let’s give our comrades a little taste of EAC bullets!

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1701
data.value: Use that hacking tool from Madelyn on those computers over there.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0316
data.value: Hmm, what the hell’s going on?

data.name: Dlg_DialoguePlaceholder
data.value: This is just a placeholder which will be replaced later

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0501
data.value: Ok, guys, go to your positions. Spread out and try to look… inconspicuous.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0601
data.value: Damn, those whores should have been paying us. There are much better places on Rime.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0701
data.value: Get out, and don’t come back! This club is for gentlemen.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0801
data.value: …Matt missed the delivery yesterday. Got drunk and had to sleep it off in a holding cell.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0901
data.value: Don’t get too close. Hang back at 300 to 650 meters, that should do the job.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_1001
data.value: Mitchell, you happen to notice that you were followed?

data.name: Dlg_Rime_1101
data.value: Ok, that’s all the guards. Grab the undeclared cargo boxes.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_1201
data.value: That should do. I think we’ve got enough.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0102
data.value: So this is the Rift-Sion lab complex.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0103
data.value: Right. You might want to go there first.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0105
data.value: The researchers in here might have some useful tips how to survive in the Rift.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0106
data.value: I am staying in here with Tarja. Our ships can’t handle the radiation and sun storms.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0201
data.value: Apollo Rainier to Rift-Sion laboratories, request for landing.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0202
data.value: Approved. Welcome to our station and enjoy the sightseeing.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0203
data.value: Ehm, thanks.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0204
data.value: I am on an expedition to the Rift itself.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0205
data.value: Can anyone give me tips for the trip?

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0206
data.value: Just a moment. I will connect you to Tourist Information office.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0301
data.value: Rift-Sion Tourist Information Office. Jennifer Smith speaking. How may I help?

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0302
data.value: Um… I’m on an expedition to the Rift. Any useful tips you can provide?

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0303
data.value: I will upload you the Rift Survival Brochure. Have a pleasant stay.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0305
data.value: …hm… always wear sunglases… use sun wind armor at all time…

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0306
data.value: …avoid hi-speed objects such as meteor storms…

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0307
data.value: …high solar wind areas… heavy radiation…

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0308
data.value: Anything interesting?

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0309
data.value: Some nice pictures.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0310
data.value: Oh well, guess I’ll be on my way.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0311
data.value: Check out the shop at Rift-Sion. They might have some useful equipment there.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0312
data.value: Make sure to buy anti-radiation meds and some medical and repair supplies.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0313
data.value: And definitely lots of fuel, it is a long way to the Rift.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0401
data.value: Guess I’m ready as I’ll ever be.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0402
data.value: Double check your seat belts. And – good luck! We’ll be waiting here.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0501
data.value: Apollo, I am losing your signal. Is everything ok?

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0502
data.value: Affirmative. Just a lot of radiation and shit.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0503
data.value: Probably disturbing my signal. You copy?

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0504
data.value: Gotcha. Do this fast.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0601
data.value: Out of signal range, swimming in radiation, and a boring mining operation ahead. Yee-haw.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0701
data.value: This plutonium deposit has a really extravagant color. Hmm.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0801
data.value: Mm, such yummy, gummy loop-tonium. Pluteenium. Go-homium.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0901
data.value: Man, this radiation is affecting my dental health. Mental wealth. And such.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_1001
data.value: This should be enough. Now, back to the station.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_1101
data.value: This is Apollo, reporting in. I have the rare plutonium.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_1102
data.value: Loads of it. And maybe even some to spare.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_1103
data.value: Oh… I… I’m glad to hear you again. Are you all right?

data.name: Dlg_Rift_1104
data.value: Yeah, getting poached in raw radiation was a nice break from being shot at.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_1106
data.value: Welcome back! Once you dock in, we can depart to Thomas.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_1107
data.value: Affirmina-tative.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_1108
data.value: Apollo?

data.name: Dlg_Rift_1110
data.value: May I ask you a personal question?

data.name: Dlg_Rift_1111
data.value: Ah… …no.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_1112
data.value: Let’s give the man some space.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_1113
data.value: Come on in. Course set to Barth’s Moon!

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0208
data.value: Tourist Information office? Here? Not too much stress on that job.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0314
data.value: Ok, thanks for the tips.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_0505
data.value: Yeah, the radiation here’ll turn me into a gummy bear in nothing flat.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0213b
data.value: We are overwhelmed at a rate of 1:7.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_1003b
data.value: Too bad we can’t help ourselves, even in an emergency.

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_1004
data.value: That’s the Trader’s Guild for you. No free goods. No exceptions.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0101
data.value: We’re back!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0102
data.value: You know, this place is starting to feel like home!

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_1005
data.value: Check it if you want but we should get to the command center ASAP.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_01_01
data.value: Welcome to the Chinese radar array at Yunzun.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_01_02
data.value: We know you have a choice in interstellar carriers…

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_01_03
data.value: …so we thank you for choosing Madelyn space airways.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_01_04
data.value: Remember, guys, we’re in a prohibited area. They will shoot first, ask questions later.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_01_05
data.value: Roger that, let’s go then. And don’t forget, act like raiders.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_01_06
data.value: Sure thing, we just knock on their doors with sabres in our hands…

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_01_07
data.value: …and they’ll all jump overboard.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_01_08
data.value: You know what I mean.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_01_09
data.value: Arrr! We’ll keelhaul ’em and feed them to the fishies.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_01_10
data.value: Why am I losing confidence by the moment?

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_01_11
data.value: I just finished my scan. There’s a side entrance through the cargo bay.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_01_12
data.value: Music to my ears.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_01_13
data.value: Uh-oh, just received a Chinese signal. Translating to English:

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_01_14
data.value: Addressing unknown vehicle: this is a prohibited area.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_01_15
data.value: Explain your purposes and leave immediately or we will fire.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_01_16
data.value: Repeat: leave or we will fire.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_01_17
data.value: Better be quick.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_01_18
data.value: Cannons at the ready, cap’n.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_01_19
data.value: Ok, what’s the plan?

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_01_20
data.value: We enter by the cargo bay.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_01_21
data.value: We loot the cargo, so it will look like a normal pillage and plunder operation.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_01_22
data.value: Right. A normal, everyday pillage and plunder, nothing unusual.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_01_23
data.value: Let the raid begin.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_02_01
data.value: Ok, you two stay here, go after that cargo and attract some attention, …

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_02_02
data.value: …I’ll go place that detector.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_02_04
data.value: They sent some ships, but no big deal.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_02_05
data.value: Good, can you navigate me through the station?

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_02_06
data.value: Sure, just give me a sec for scanning.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_02_07
data.value: Ok, I’ll head inside, let me know when you have something for me.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_02_08
data.value: Come on, Valentin, let’s look around, see what booty we can find.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_03_01
data.value: I see lots of cameras. You’ll have to turn them off.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_03_02
data.value: The security center should be in the upper level.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_03_03
data.value: Copy.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_04_01
data.value: Can you hack those computers?

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_04_02
data.value: Negative, too many of them. It would take ages.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_04_03
data.value: Then you’ll have to destroy the generator that powers this room.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_04_04
data.value: Destroying generators is my new hobby.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_05_01
data.value: Power is off, can you navigate me to the command center?

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_05_02
data.value: Yes, it’s in the center of the asteroid.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_05_03
data.value: Great. Tarja, what’s your status?

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_05_04
data.value: A few guards, no big deal. And we’ve got some sweet boo-tay.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_05_05
data.value: Er… No comment.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_06_01
data.value: WAIT! I just made deep scan of the command center. It is heavily guarded.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_06_02
data.value: Give me a minute and I’ll find where you can disable it.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_06_03
data.value: Apollo, hurry up, reinforcements just arrived!

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_06_04
data.value: I found it. Coordinates sent.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_06_05
data.value: Hold on Tarja, I’m almost in the command center.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_07_01
data.value: Apollo, where are you? It’s getting pretty hot in here.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_07_02
data.value: Go back to Madelyn, I can find my way out on my own.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_07_03
data.value: Negative, they cut us off.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_07_04
data.value: I’ll be there as fast as I can. Madelyn, is the command center safe now?

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_07_05
data.value: If you turned off those turrets…

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_08_01
data.value: Detector placed, I just hope they don’t spot it. Tarja, hold on, I’m on my way.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_09_01
data.value: Tarja, I’m glad you two are still alive!

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_09_02
data.value: We won’t be much longer if we stand here and chat.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_09_03
data.value: So let’s go. Madelyn, what’s your status?

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_09_04
data.value: Ready when you are.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_09_05
data.value: Great, we’re on our way. Well, I think it was a success.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_09_06
data.value: Just an everyday pillage and plunder.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_09_07
data.value: Arrrr! Them scurvy-ridden harbor hogs didn’t stand a chance.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_09_08
data.value: I think we’re all set, so you can belay the Jack Tar routine.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_09_09
data.value: Aye aye, cap’n.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_09_10
data.value: No, really, please stop. Thank you.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_10_01
data.value: Mission complete. Madelyn, can you get us out of here?

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_10_02
data.value: If you give me a little push in the right direction…

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_10_03
data.value: Russia. The radar array of Tver.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_10_04
data.value: You want to save the EAC radar array for last, right?

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_10_05
data.value: I do.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransmitter_10_06
data.value: Course set. Dock in!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0108
data.value: Let’s say hello to Thomas. I think he’ll be happy to see us again!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0109
data.value: Thomas, do you copy?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0110
data.value: I am here, my friends, and eager to hear of your exploits!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0111
data.value: Mission accomplished!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0112
data.value: Raiders successfully terminated and communication components secured.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0114
data.value: I am pleased to hear such good news! I have something for you as well…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0116
data.value: Read it on your way here.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0201
data.value: I’m going through the data Thomas just sent. The whole situation is… unbelievable!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0202
data.value: What exactly do you mean?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0203
data.value: …now I completely understand why Thomas was so excited when we first arrived…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0204
data.value: …and told him about the artifacts.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0206
data.value: I’ll let Thomas do the explaining. Meanwhile, I’ll go through the rest of the data…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0301
data.value: So what do you think?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0302
data.value: You’d better explain all this in your own words. The data you sent is… complex.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0304
data.value: As I said earlier, there are reasons to believe that…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0305
data.value: …there was an ancient alien impact on the evolution of humankind.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0306
data.value: Dismiss it as nonsense if you wish, but those Russians believe it.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0307
data.value: And back in the Deimos labs, we believed too. For good reason.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0308
data.value: Anyway, if it was true, then there has to be some remains of the aliens…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0309
data.value: …or their technology, in our Solar System.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0310
data.value: Technology we might possibly employ…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0311
data.value: Biological samples we might…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0312
data.value: …utilize to enhance our own genome.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0313
data.value: That’s what the Reichists were after! A shortening of the way!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0314
data.value: Precisely! Think of the way we put human diseases into bacteria, make them resistant…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0315
data.value: …and then implant the resulting inhibitors into humans…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0316
data.value: Imagine if we implanted the effective parts of alien DNA…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0317
data.value: …which is several evolutionary steps above ours, into humans.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0318
data.value: You think this is what those Russians are after?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0319
data.value: Perhaps. But I’d guess they are more interested in the technology.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0320
data.value: Analyzing those alien materials and…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0321
data.value: …devices could help them create futuristic weapons.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0324
data.value: Now, before we talk further, I want you to check these coordinates.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0401
data.value: Proceed to this location. It will take a few minutes to get there.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0402
data.value: I will explain everything on the way.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0403
data.value: Ok. You can start anytime…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0404
data.value: The place you are going to is the remains of the old Deimos laboratory complex.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0405
data.value: This can’t be! Deimos’ moon must have been crushed during…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0406
data.value: …the Solar Event like all the other solar bodies!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0407
data.value: I did not say it was the whole moon. It is just a… shard. But it contains…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0408
data.value: …laboratories… with technologies useful to our current situation.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0409
data.value: Why haven’t you gone there yourself?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0410
data.value: I have. Several times. Hit-and-run.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0411
data.value: Many of my devices are from the Broken Moon, as I call it.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0412
data.value: Why hit-and-run?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0413
data.value: Right – there can’t be anyone living there, except maybe… space nazi zombies.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0414
data.value: Come on, no one could survive in there!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0415
data.value: No humans. But… machines, computers. Artificial intelligence.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0416
data.value: We had a technology for AI fighter pilots long before the solar event.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0417
data.value: I wonder what else YOU know that we don’t.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0418
data.value: Not much, but I’ll tell you a few more stories later.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0419
data.value: What’s the plan?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0420
data.value: Get inside, turn up the emergency power unit, kick off the AI weapons.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0421
data.value: And get me a few components.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0422
data.value: Roger that.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0501
data.value: Might need to dig or blast our way through this pile of dirt.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0601
data.value: Here we go. I’m detecting radiation around here.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0602
data.value: And the deeper we go, the stronger it gets.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0603
data.value: You must turn on the backup energy supply first.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0604
data.value: Do not waste time or the radiation will consume you alive!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0701
data.value: Good. Now, you need to turn on the main energy generators.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0703
data.value: There should be drones! Emergency maintenance drones.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0704
data.value: Find them and if they are still operational, they can do the job.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0705
data.value: I saw a small maintenance room on the way here. Let’s check it out.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0801
data.value: Nice! The drones survived. I mean, they’re still operational.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0802
data.value: Great! Use them to do the dirty work

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0803
data.value: First “park” your ship in the area without radiation.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0804
data.value: The drones are immune to it, but you’re not.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_0901
data.value: Apollo, you handle the drone. Find a way to lead it to the generators.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_1001
data.value: Here we go. About to fire this one up.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_1101
data.value: Up and running!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_1102
data.value: Crap, it’s overheating and –

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_1201
data.value: Bad luck. Try the other generator with the other drone.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_1202
data.value: Workin’ on it.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_1301
data.value: I’m here. Let’s spin the wheel of fortune again.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_1401
data.value: Yeah! Roll, baby!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_1402
data.value: Wait a few seconds.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_1403
data.value: Ok, it seems this one is stable.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_1404
data.value: Good, I see you have lights on! Head to the main control room.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_1501
data.value: I see some nice stuff around there. Would you mind getting the data from each of hubs?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_1502
data.value: There should be four of them.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_1503
data.value: Do we have to hit all four of them?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_1504
data.value: Yes, the data is hashed. Get it from only one computer and it’s of no use to me.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_1505
data.value: What exactly are we after?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_1506
data.value: Results of genetic research. Classified materials.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_1507
data.value: Even I did not have access to them before.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_1508
data.value: Once you’re done, I need you to pick up a few special devices

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_1509
data.value: I will tell you when you come across one.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_1601
data.value: We’ve got company.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_1602
data.value: Damn, and we forgot to buy wine. Security bots!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_1701
data.value: This place is radiated. Apollo, work fast.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_1702
data.value: Roger that.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_1801
data.value: Done. Movin’ on.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_1901
data.value: Damn, this is bad. Critical radiation level in this one.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_1902
data.value: I suggest using drones again. Same procedure as before.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_1903
data.value: Stop your ship in a safe area and let the drone get its hands dirty.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_1905
data.value: I’d just eat Marcus’s cooking.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2001
data.value: All set here.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2002
data.value: One more computer to go.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2101
data.value: Good job, Apollo!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2102
data.value: Now, according to the scans, the components I need are in the main lab.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2103
data.value: Just… be careful there. I don’t know whether Blondi is still alive…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2104
data.value: Blondi?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2105
data.value: Better not to ask. Just… always look around corners.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2106
data.value: Great! Blondi? What the hell is that?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2107
data.value: Guess we’ll find out soon enough. Head to the main lab.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2201
data.value: Jeez… is this –

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2202
data.value: Emergency security measures! Overriding human safety protocol. Mainframe CORE endangered!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2203
data.value: Blondi?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2204
data.value: We’re locked in. She… I mean, IT sealed all the doors.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2205
data.value: Blondi! She is alive!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2206
data.value: “She” has just targeted all of her defense systems on us.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2207
data.value: Is she always this polite to guests?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2208
data.value: Try not to damage her! She’s – a masterpiece!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2209
data.value: You prefer us to be damaged instead?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2210
data.value: Apollo, concentrate all your firepower on our… lady friend.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2211
data.value: Thomas, what’s this all about?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2212
data.value: An experiment! A successful one! She survived all these years!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2213
data.value: Too bad we have to spoil your perfect record.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2214
data.value: No!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2215
data.value: You understand we have no other choice? That thing is firing on us repeatedly –

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2216
data.value: Am I… hurt?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2217
data.value: You are…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2218
data.value: Killing my children…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2219
data.value: And now…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2220
data.value: You come to kill…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2221
data.value: Me?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2222
data.value: You must save her! For the sake of science and humanity, you must –

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2223
data.value: If you tell me “she” feels pain, I will consider killing you as well, Dr. Frankenstein.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2224
data.value: She does not, although she simulates emotions.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2225
data.value: She is one of the greatest achievements of science.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2226
data.value: Destroying her would throw us back years in biogenetic research.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2227
data.value: Did you say biogenetic?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2228
data.value: Ehm, yes, biogenetic.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2229
data.value: I mean – she is not “electronic” in the true sense of the world.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2230
data.value: Holy crap! Are you telling me this computer is alive?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2301
data.value: “She”’s nearly down!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2302
data.value: Save her! I beg you! Don’t destroy her, just… disable her!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2401
data.value: Farewell to humankind! Blondi out

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2501
data.value: Nooooo! Years of work turned to ashes!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2502
data.value: Target dispatched. Well done, Apollo!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2503
data.value: What next? Thomas?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2504
data.value: You… How could you?… How could you?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2505
data.value: Guys, I got the data from Thomas earlier.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2506
data.value: According to his list, he needs some devices from around this room.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2507
data.value: I’ll mark them on your HUD. Grab ’em and go.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2508
data.value: Are we about to disassemble the satellite dish?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2509
data.value: Seems so. Some of the items on the list look like additional components…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2510
data.value: …for the long-range transmitter we’re supposed to build.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2511
data.value: Some of the other stuff is… well, biological.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2512
data.value: I am not bringing Dr. Frankenstein any more body parts.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2513
data.value: The components should be sufficient. Trust me. I will transfer you the list.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2514
data.value: Whatever. Apollo, gather the components. I’ll wait for you at the lab entrance.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2601
data.value: I guess we’re all set.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2602
data.value: Confirmed. Come on back home, guys!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2701
data.value: Wow, selling stuff from this place could make us millions!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2702
data.value: Wait, what are those two ships?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2703
data.value: We’ve got competition! Shoot them!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2704
data.value: Seems some looters found their way in, too.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2801
data.value: That should be it. The path to the exit is clear.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2802
data.value: Be careful. I’m willing to bet those raiders have some friends.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2901
data.value: Damn. You were right. How do we get past them?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2902
data.value: Sorry to being this up, but remember… Thomas’s base is just a few kilometers away.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2903
data.value: We can’t leave those raiders alive.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2904
data.value: Madelyn, is that really you?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2905
data.value: Saying we have to kill someone instead of sparing his life?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2906
data.value: Circumstances.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_2907
data.value: Agreed. We need to crush those ships, otherwise they might endanger Thomas.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_3001
data.value: Area clear.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_3002
data.value: Nice job, guys!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_3101
data.value: Thomas, we’re on the way back.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_3102
data.value: And we have the components you requested.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_3103
data.value: Ok, ok. Bring them here.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_3104
data.value: I’m sending you the data we downloaded from the computers.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_3105
data.value: What next?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_3106
data.value: Give me some time to analyze the data.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_3107
data.value: For now, would you mind helping me build that communication array?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_3108
data.value: A job that won’t get us killed? That’ll be a refreshing change.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_3201
data.value: The array should work now!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_3202
data.value: It… works… Just…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_3203
data.value: What? Problems?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_3204
data.value: No, but I’m already picking up a signal.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_3205
data.value: That might be our signal. I have several relays and communication channels open.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_3206
data.value: No, that’s – not – it.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_3208
data.value: It appears to be a distress signal. Sent earlier today.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_3209
data.value: Periodically repeating. See for yourself.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_3210
data.value: …This is… Christian community Last Hope.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_3211
data.value: We are under attack. Slavers…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_3212
data.value: …we are requesting help! If anyone hears this, …

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_3213
data.value: …please come to our assistance. Our coordinates are…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_3214
data.value: I’ve located the source of the signal.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_3215
data.value: I suppose you want us to help them?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_3216
data.value: That’s your decision.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_3217
data.value: The signal was sent several hours ago, so there’s probably no one alive anymore.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_3218
data.value: Or they may have gotten help from someone else.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_3219
data.value: Doubtful. Their base is so far from any civilized settlement…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_3220
data.value: …it would be impossible for the signal to reach.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_3221
data.value: It’s just a fluke that we received it.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoon2_3222
data.value: It’s worth a try. We might be able to save some lives.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1000
data.value: Here we go!

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1001
data.value: This structure looks like one of those concentration camps…

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1002
data.value: …the Nazis made during World War 2.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1003
data.value: It’s very close. I have seen many photos of those camps before.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1004
data.value: We need to get waste samples from outside.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1005
data.value: Valentin, Tarja – cover me!

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1006
data.value: All looks well. It seems the area is clear.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1007
data.value: Head to the station and look for the inner part of the biomachine.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1008
data.value: And take samples of the materials they’re using.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1009
data.value: I’ll do my best, just I’m staying away from that slimy green shit.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1010
data.value: It wasn’t that bad.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1011
data.value: The hardest part is still ahead of you.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1012
data.value: This place sickens me. Just like the Reichists!

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1013
data.value: I thought it was overtaken by separatists.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1014
data.value: Right, but do you think they started this all stuff?

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1015
data.value: Whoever did it is pretty fucked up.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1016
data.value: Do we even have any clue who these separatists are?

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1017
data.value: No idea. I’ll ask von Stauffenberg the next time we meet.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1018
data.value: They look like Reichists, quack like Reichists.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1019
data.value: Hard to tell the difference.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1020
data.value: This should be pretty straightforward. Just download the blueprint data.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1021
data.value: Is that all? Download the blueprints and… burn this place?

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1022
data.value: We need several more components. At least according to the list from Stauffenberg.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1023
data.value: Fine. Let’s do those tasks ASAP, so we can get out of here.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1024
data.value: Now for the highlight of this evening’s entertainment.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1025
data.value: The fireworks display.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1026
data.value: I don’t understand why the Reich wants us to destroy this place.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1027
data.value: Can’t they use it themselves?

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1028
data.value: They’re all about teaching lessons.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1029
data.value: Whatever.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1030
data.value: Be careful and aim at the lower exterior part of the biomachine.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1031
data.value: Do it from a safe distance – near the fence will be ok.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1032
data.value: Otherwise you’ll blow along with it.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1033
data.value: No cracks about blowing things, Tarja.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1034
data.value: You read my mind.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1035
data.value: It’s an easy read.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1036
data.value: Wow, that was more than I bargained for.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1037
data.value: Let’s blow something else up. You know, just for fun.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1038
data.value: Calm down, Tarja, one’s enough.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1039
data.value: Madelyn, don’t tell me the party’s over?

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1041
data.value: Come on guys, come back to Sapho. A warm hangar and some cookies await.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1042
data.value: Hm. Cookies?

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1043
data.value: You know. The synthetic stuff.

data.name: Dlg_WhitewolvesResearch_1044
data.value: Right now, everything sounds better than… biological stuff.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0302
data.value: Do not underestimate these red lads.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1605
data.value: Enjoy your last moments of life, pigs!

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1606
data.value: Dance, zalupa!

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1607
data.value: Damn, turrets are firing on us from all around!

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1608
data.value: We need to take out the generator. That’ll cut their power.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0303a
data.value: I’ll pretend you didn’t say that.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0303b
data.value: And I’ll pretend you didn’t say that.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0303c
data.value: I should be fine here.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0304a
data.value: …those fighters and turrets can barely scratch my paint.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0314a
data.value: …are definitely not standard issue for the Russian army.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0400
data.value: Quite the well-stocked marketplace!

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0401
data.value: Too bad they won’t sell us a thing now.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0712a
data.value: …a maintenance fleet to cover all traces of your presence.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0810
data.value: Use them for “persuasive purposes”?

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0811
data.value: Why not? It might work, it might not. Anyway, it won’t take long to try.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0812
data.value: Agreed.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0901
data.value: This thing could vaporize whole place in a nanosecond.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0902
data.value: I guess it’s not surprising. After all, this is not a civilian trade station.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0903
data.value: Right. Let’s move on to the second satellite.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_0950
data.value: Apollo, you need to use your hacking device to arm it.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1800
data.value: Done.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1801
data.value: Back to Sapho now.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1802
data.value: Things are getting a little hairy here. Status?

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1803
data.value: We are going to try to, ehm, negotiate.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1804
data.value: Attention, commander:

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1805
data.value: We found your surprise package – the nuclear one.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1805a
data.value: It’s armed and my finger is on the trigger.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1806
data.value: If you pursue us – do svidaniya.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1807
data.value: Cease your fire and we will disarm the warhead when leaving the sector.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1808
data.value: Will it work?

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1809
data.value: Who knows?

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1900
data.value: Marcus, Apollo, look behind you!

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1901
data.value: Ahm, so I’m guessing negotiations failed.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1902
data.value: They let their own Trade station explode?

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1903
data.value: Why didn’t they send some engineers to disarm it?

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1904
data.value: I’m guessing catching us is more important. The question is why?

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1905
data.value: Apollo. The data you got. Does it lead anywhere?

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1906
data.value: I seem to have two clues.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1907
data.value: A name of some scientist, Thomas Barth…

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1908
data.value: And coordinates of a base located within Damien Dust Field.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1909
data.value: Thomas Barth?

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1910
data.value: You know him? This Barth guy?

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1911
data.value: Sure! I’m setting the course right now.

data.name: Dlg_Laika_1912
data.value: I hope you like him. I’ll tell you more on the way.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_2000
data.value: I still can’t believe he’s gone.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_2001
data.value: I know. But the best thing we can do is to finish what we started… Together.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_2002
data.value: Continue with this insane adventure? Lose more people?

data.name: Dlg_Rift_2003
data.value: So next time it’s you, or Tarja, or Valentin, or me?

data.name: Dlg_Rift_2004
data.value: Madelyn, calm down. We all chose this path voluntarily.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_2005
data.value: Marcus knew about the risks, just like we did.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_2007
data.value: I… I know, just… ok, let’s go on.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_2008
data.value: Apollo, head to the coordinates I just sent you.

data.name: Dlg_Rift_2009
data.value: On my way. And… Madelyn? Thanks.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0101
data.value: Rime! The heart of the OmniCorp!

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0102
data.value: This guy we’re after, this Francis Reef…

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0103
data.value: Yeah?

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0104
data.value: Madelyn, you have some more info on him?

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0105
data.value: Not much. Classified OC personnel, 2nd security circle.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0106
data.value: Employee file says: Francis Reef, born 2045, OmniCorp citizen,

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0107
data.value: …Assistant Director of Research and Development.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0108
data.value: No other data in the channels I checked.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0109
data.value: The OmniCorp guys must keep a close eye on him.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0110
data.value: Time to chat him up. Head to the Research Quadrant.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0111
data.value: Research Quadrant?

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0112
data.value: First time in Rime, Valentin?

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0113
data.value: OmniCorp is divided into four parts, like four segments of a huge… donut.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0114
data.value: A quarter of this big-ass bitch is a research department?

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0115
data.value: Kind of. I was stuck in here for months once, doing some errands for a client.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0116
data.value: Interesting city.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0117
data.value: Looks sterile from the outside, but has its “underbelly” –

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0118
data.value: bars, casinos, “houses of ill repute”.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0119
data.value: I don’t think we’re going to have time for that

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0120
data.value: Don’t underestimate OC officials.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0121
data.value: Like the city, they look sterile and proper from the outside, but underneath…

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0122
data.value: I get what you’re saying.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1000
data.value: Huge and pathetic. We must be in Russia!

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1001
data.value: Thanks for reminding me. The sooner we finish this, the sooner we can leave.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1002
data.value: So what’s the plan? Just fly there, shoot everything, plant the detector, and scram?

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1003
data.value: Sort of…

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1004
data.value: Tarja, if you say, “Aye, matey”, I’m going to have to kill you.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1005
data.value: This building is heavily guarded and full of turrets.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1006
data.value: We can’t just knock on the front door – see that side entrance?

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1007
data.value: OK, got it. Tarja, Valentin: Let’s move in and place the detector fast.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1008
data.value: Roger that!

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1009
data.value: The most important part of the base and you can access it from the backdoor.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1010
data.value: I don’t get the Russian mentality.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1011
data.value: Stay back! It’s highly radioactive!

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1012
data.value: Not funny… Find the base entrance. Please, hurry, I’ve already shot down two guards.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1013
data.value: Now find a computer or security hub, hack it and send me back the broadcast frequency.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1014
data.value: I have to prepare the detector device so it will be compatible with the Russian signal.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1015
data.value: Clever! God, I hate Russian ships. So ugly and…

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1016
data.value: Just shut up and shoot.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1017
data.value: Here it is!

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1018
data.value: If it’s same security level as that nuclear generator, we’ll be back for tea at five!

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1022
data.value: I can access the signal, but it seems encrypted. Madelyn?

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1023
data.value: You’re right. It looks like advanced military coding.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1024
data.value: We don’t have a chance of decrypting it ourselves.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1025
data.value: Why would they…? Hold on…

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1026
data.value: I just got a call. Some stranger is watching us.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1027
data.value: He wants to meet us. Here are his coordinates.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1028
data.value: Can we trust him? Who is he?

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1029
data.value: He said he can help. That’s all.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1030
data.value: Well, then I guess he’s fine.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1031
data.value: Greetings, strangers! I have a deal to propose.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1032
data.value: Hey, what are you doing on our private channel?

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1033
data.value: Speaking to you. I have information about code breaking… Isn’t that what you want?

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1034
data.value: OK, so what do YOU want out of this?

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1035
data.value: Just meet me here, we’ll discuss it personally.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1036
data.value: Welcome to my humble commode. My name is Volodia.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1037
data.value: Look at those shipboard screens: that is small part of your desired code.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1038
data.value: Do you wish to have the rest?

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1039
data.value: Let’s make it quick: what do you want from us?

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1040
data.value: Straightforward and lacking nonsense, I like this.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1041
data.value: You will steal some military items for me.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1042
data.value: This keeps getting better and better.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1043
data.value: Anything more specific than “military items”?

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1044
data.value: Here, these are the coordinates. You will know when you get there.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1045
data.value: After you finish, I will send you more coordinates where we will meet.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1046
data.value: Hey, look at that! Isn’t that a nuke?

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1047
data.value: Don’t touch it! Just take the cargo.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1048
data.value: Great! Meet me at the solar power plant. Try not to get blown up with that box on board!

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1049
data.value: Ehm… So I guess you’ve been watching us the whole time?

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1050
data.value: Call it “business insurance”.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1051
data.value: Who are you?

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1052
data.value: Does it matter?

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1053
data.value: Maybe I’ll just throw that stupid box of yours overboard and watch it fly away…

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1054
data.value: And never learn the code… Think about it. What’s the problem, do you feel manipulated?

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1055
data.value: A little bit…

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1056
data.value: That’s because you ARE!

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1057
data.value: We are all manipulated and it doesn’t matter on which side we’re standing.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1058
data.value: At least tell us: which side are you standing on?

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1059
data.value: I don’t care about Russia, I don’t care about you. I’m on my own side.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1060
data.value: Didn’t I tell you Russians are pathetic?

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1061
data.value: Enough talk. Bring that cargo to me so we can all leave this sector.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1062
data.value: Here’s your cargo.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1063
data.value: And here is your code.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1064
data.value: One last question: are you…

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1065
data.value: Red alert! Enemy mother ship approaching! Looks like government commando!

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1066
data.value: Bliať!

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1067
data.value: …a spy?

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1068
data.value: This is the Federation guard. Sergei Romanov speaking. Surrender immediately!

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1069
data.value: NEVER! Come on, comrades, show them we know how to fight!

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1070
data.value: Engage the enemy!

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1071
data.value: Oh… my… god…

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1072
data.value: There’s too many of them!

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1073
data.value: Keep your distance from that mother ship!

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1074
data.value: We’ll try. Tarja, watch your back!

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1075
data.value: Enough! Get back to the transmitter before another commando approaches.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1076
data.value: We don’t have much time. Let’s hope we have the right decryption. Watch out for turrets!

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1077
data.value: If this doesn’t work, I swear I will find Volodia’s corpse and sell it for dog food!

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1078
data.value: It’s working!

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1079
data.value: Great, send the data back to me and find another hub to upload our signal data.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1080
data.value: Signal uploading!

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1081
data.value: Now find the main room entrance. We have to place the device and start triangulating.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1082
data.value: No chance to get inside from here. There’s some kind of power field.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1083
data.value: We must find another way from inside.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1084
data.value: Here it is!

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1085
data.value: Place the device on the transmitter.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1086
data.value: Done!

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1087
data.value: …and working! Great job! Now, please return.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1088
data.value: There are still some power-plugged doors, we have to open them from a hub.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1089
data.value: We made it!

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1092
data.value: Before you proceed with the placement of the last detector at EAC…

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1093
data.value: …I suggest you get your brother out of prison.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1094
data.value: That’s not funny, Thomas. Why would you say such a thing?

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1095
data.value: You haven’t watched the news lately?

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1096
data.value: There was an interview with a man they claim killed all the people in New Landswick…

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1097
data.value: …and blew up the peaceful Russian trade station Laika.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1098
data.value: You… you mean Marcus is alive?

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1099
data.value: I am sure. I checked some black market data sources.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1100
data.value: Marcus Rainier is on the prisoners’ list at Reway, the toughest of EAC prisons.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1101
data.value: Sentenced to death, by the way.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1102
data.value: To be executed in about three or four days – the data is not clear on this point.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1103
data.value: So we might see the big boss again?

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1104
data.value: Possibly. Just don’t try anything stupid like a direct assault on Reway.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1105
data.value: You can’t do this job on your own.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1106
data.value: I’m… guessing you already have a plan, right?

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1107
data.value: Meet Colonel von Stauffenberg in Reichstag. He is your key to freeing Marcus.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1108
data.value: You’re suggesting we ally ourselves with the Nazis?

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1109
data.value: Reichists. Yes. The end is more important than the means – at least in this case.

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1110
data.value: What in God’s name will von Stauffenberg want from us in return?

data.name: Dlg_RussianTransmitter_1111
data.value: I don’t think God’s name will enter into it.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0201
data.value: This should be it. Reef’s residence.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0202
data.value: Shall we knock on the–

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0203
data.value: Greetings, gentlemen.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0204
data.value: My name is Francis Reef, Assistant Director of OC Research and Development.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0205
data.value: What exactly brings you to pay me a visit?

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0206
data.value: We need a genius technician. Maybe you know of one.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0207
data.value: Someone able to construct a metal detector…

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0208
data.value: …for a substance far beyond the knowledge of modern science.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0209
data.value: Hm… And what does this technician get in return?

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0210
data.value: The thrill of being the first person ever to experiment with an alien substance.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0211
data.value: I need to think this out. You’re mercenaries, I take it?

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0212
data.value: We prefer the term freelancer.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0213
data.value: Ok. Here’s the deal. You do me a favor, I’ll do you a favor.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0214
data.value: Or let’s just say – you need to convince me you’re not just low-level pirates.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0216
data.value: You want an exceptional scientist for an extraordinary task?

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0217
data.value: Fine, but I work only with other exceptional people.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0218
data.value: What’s this favor?

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0219
data.value: I have a “political” opponent in the company hierarchy. Jim Raynolds.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0220
data.value: He is attracting a great deal of cash for his campaign. And he hates me.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0221
data.value: Why is not important. But I need something on him.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0222
data.value: All the private detectives I’ve hired have found nothing.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0223
data.value: If I am to advance in my career, I need to be able to blackmail Raynolds.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0224
data.value: What – you want us to kidnap his wife and daughter?

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0225
data.value: Nothing that… personal.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0226
data.value: There is a large underground supply of illegal alcohol in Rime.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0227
data.value: That means tax evasion, to the tune of millions of credits a month.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0228
data.value: In the industrial quadrant there’s a place called the Duplex bar.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0229
data.value: It definitely has some connection to the black market.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0230
data.value: Go there, keep your eyes open. Track the source of the alcohol.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0231
data.value: Then… steal as many cargo boxes of it as you can.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0232
data.value: Drop them inside Raynolds’s diplomatic vessel. That’s it. I’ll take care of the rest.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0233
data.value: Hmm, that monologue was cued up for quite some time.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0234
data.value: Ok, we’re on it.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0235
data.value: Mr. Reef, check the data I just transmitted you. You might find it… interesting.

data.name: Dlg_Rime_0236
data.value: Very well.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_01_01
data.value: What a lovely place! Reconsidering your vacation plans?

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_01_02
data.value: Let’s give this place a facelift! Guys, load up your guns!

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_02_01
data.value: First, you have to completely destroy their air defense. Keep a safe distance.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_02_02
data.value: Let’s see who can destroy the most turrets in the shortest time!

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_02_03
data.value: You already lost…

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_03_01
data.value: Oy! Stop shooting! You can voluntarily surrender!

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_03_02
data.value: What’s Option B?

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_03_03
data.value: We can tear your ships apart and sell them for scrap metal…

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_03_04
data.value: We’ll go with Option C!

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_03_05
data.value: Unleash the dogs!

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_04_01
data.value: Now we have to unlock the cells. Find the hubs at slaver headquarters.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_04_02
data.value: Copy that!

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_05_03
data.value: Now go do the second one.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_06_01
data.value: Now we can free the prisoners!

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_06_02
data.value: Not yet. See those power grids? They’re still working.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_06_03
data.value: I guess we only unlocked the first level of security.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_06_04
data.value: Right. But my scanners can’t find any other hub.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_06_05
data.value: We don’t need a hub. Where’s the generator? No power – no grids.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_06_06
data.value: Clever boy!

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_07_01
data.value: The generator. Let’s cook it up!

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_07_02
data.value: Fried or mashed?

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_07_03
data.value: Both.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_08_01
data.value: No other security systems detected. The prisoners are free!

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_08_02
data.value: I love being the good guy.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_08_03
data.value: We need to evacuate everyone. Have you seen any transports?

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_08_04
data.value: Only two. Not enough for everybody, but I’m sure the Templars will send more.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_08_05
data.value: We just need to physically open all the prison cells.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_09_01
data.value: First prisoner cell unlocked!

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_10_01
data.value: Second prisoner cell open. These guys are free to go.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_10_02
data.value: I already sent a message to the Templars.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_10_03
data.value: They’re sending transport ships to pick them up.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_11_01
data.value: Third prisoner cell unlocked.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_11_02
data.value: Two more remaining.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_12_01
data.value: Fourth prisoner group is free. One more and we’re done here.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_13_01
data.value: Final cell open. That was it. We’ve unlocked all of them.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_13_02
data.value: Now what? We’re supposed to leave these poor people here to fend for themselves?

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_13_03
data.value: They can make it out on their own and wait for the Templar transports.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_13_04
data.value: Madelyn, am I right?

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_13_05
data.value: Confirmed.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_13_06
data.value: Everyone should be safe for now.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_13_07
data.value: There aren’t many slavers left here, at least till their reinforcements arrive.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_13_08
data.value: Guys! The first Templar transport ships confirmed their arrival within several minutes.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_13_09
data.value: They even have some escort ships with them.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_13_10
data.value: We’re fine, then. Mission successful. Let’s get back to Valiant and collect our reward.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0100
data.value: Majestic Fort Valiant! Right before our very eyes!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0101
data.value: I’ve always dreamt of being a knight. Rescuing dragons, slaying princesses…

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0102
data.value: Sounds like you had a plan!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0103
data.value: Okay, back to reality: Any idea who we should talk to about the artifact?

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0104
data.value: We need to meet with high-ranking Templar officials and that won’t be easy.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0105
data.value: Impossible might be a better word.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0106
data.value: So what do you suggest, guys?

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0107
data.value: Hm… asking at the gates, maybe?

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0108
data.value: What would we do without you, Madelyn?

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0109
data.value: Templars hire contractors to do dirty work for them.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0110
data.value: You know – hunting down pirates and slavers.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0111
data.value: Do one or two jobs for them…

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0112
data.value: …and we might get a step closer to a meeting with the patriarchs.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0113
data.value: That… would take some time. But at least it’s a plan.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0114
data.value: And besides meeting with the higher-ups…

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0115
data.value: …we can get our hands on some cash as well and some cool Templar gadgets.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0200
data.value: Hail visitors! Please, state the nature of your business.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0201
data.value: We are mercenaries. Offering services for good cause at decent rates.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0202
data.value: Acknowledged.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0203
data.value: Proceed to the Hall of Swords and meet with Captain Cedric of the Protectors division.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0204
data.value: Much gratitude, my friend!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0300
data.value: Greetings. You are the new recruits?

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0301
data.value: Independent contractors.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0302
data.value: Good, good. We have several problems in remote sectors which…

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0303
data.value: …for regulous reasons we cannot handle with our regular troops.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0304
data.value: Recently, there have been numerous slaver raids in the asteroid fields around…

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0305
data.value: …sector Z7 of the Jupiter belt.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0306
data.value: We have the rumored location of a slaver base. If you accept this assignment, …

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0307
data.value: …you will travel there, put a stop to the slavers’ vicious activity and free the captives.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0308
data.value: Peacefully or forcefully, it is your prerogative.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0309
data.value: And the reward?

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0310
data.value: Depends on how much… “work” is required.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0311
data.value: The range is 5–15 thousand credits for each of you.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0312
data.value: Agreed.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0313
data.value: Excellent. I am transmitting the coordinates to you. Once you are done…

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0314
data.value: …return to me for the reward, as well as further tasks if mutually agreed upon.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0315
data.value: Understood. Farewell, then, Captain…?

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0316
data.value: Cedric. Farewell, and may God smile upon your mission!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0317
data.value: Ok, guys. Whenever you’re ready, jump in!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0318
data.value: But you might want to think about buying some supplies and ammo here at Valiant.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0319
data.value: The Templars should have a pretty mean selection of goods.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0320
data.value: As far as I know, most of their really cool stuff is only for members of the Order.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0321
data.value: Not available to us. At least for now.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0322
data.value: At least legally.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0323
data.value: Never mind, then. Just check out the vendors.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0324
data.value: The basic stuff should be readily available from them.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantA_0325
data.value: We might get to the specialty items later, once we earn the Templars’ confidence.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantB_0100
data.value: Here we are. I suggest heading straight to Captain Cedric for debriefing and some cash.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantB_0101
data.value: Right. On our way.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantB_0102
data.value: Oh, and try to find a subtle way to ask about a permit to buy more advanced equipment.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantB_0201
data.value: Greetings! Welcome to Valiant again!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantB_0202
data.value: I’ve seen the mission report you sent. Excellent results!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantB_0203
data.value: Sad you couldn’t resolve it in a peaceful way – but still, well done!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantB_0204
data.value: I have ordered a cash transfer of 10,000 credits to each of you.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantB_0205
data.value: By the way – can we get our mitts on a Templar supplementary license?

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantB_0207
data.value: Assuming you join us in our campaign toward protecting interstellar justice!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantB_0208
data.value: Just sign this document and…

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantB_0209
data.value: …signed…

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantB_0210
data.value: Fine!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantB_0211
data.value: Now, as fellow believers, you have access to specialized Templar supplies and equipment.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantB_0212
data.value: It’s not everything our Order has to offer, but considering you are such new members…

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantB_0213
data.value: …you should be amazed!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantB_0214
data.value: So! Are you eager for another assignment?

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantB_0215
data.value: Sure!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantB_0216
data.value: Sure…

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantB_0217
data.value: Then here it is. It’s… an another slaver base wipeout!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantB_0218
data.value: Great!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantB_0219
data.value: Great…

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantB_0220
data.value: If you’re interested, just use the coordinates I’ve transmitted.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantB_0221
data.value: Payment as usual, based on your mission report. And… good luck!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantB_0222
data.value: Ok, guys, you know the drill. Meet me at the docks when you’re ready to head out.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantB_0223
data.value: But first, check out those new supplies and equipment.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantB_0224
data.value: One more thing. Captain Cedric?

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantB_0225
data.value: I’m all ears!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantB_0226
data.value: We need you to arrange a meeting for us with high-ranking Templar officials.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantB_0227
data.value: We have some important matters to discuss.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantB_0228
