data.value: You mean the patriarchs? That… won’t be easy. But…

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantB_0229
data.value: …if you do well on this mission, I’ll recommend you for an audience.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantB_0230
data.value: When you get back, I’ll let you know whether I succeeded.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_01_01
data.value: These are the right coordinates. This must be the slaver base Cedric spoke about.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_01_02
data.value: Does it make any sense to negotiate?

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_01_03
data.value: I doubt it. We can try, but…

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_01_06
data.value: Our plan, then?

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_01_07
data.value: Destroy the generators first, to cut the turrets off from the energy supply.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_02_01
data.value: Looks like they’ve still got functional backup batteries.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_02_02
data.value: We need to take care of those, too.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_02_03
data.value: Right.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_03_01
data.value: Most of the stationary defenses appear to be down.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_03_02
data.value: I suggest we proceed with rescuing the captives.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_03_03
data.value: We need to find the prison, or whatever they call it.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_04_01
data.value: Holy crap, there’s a lot of people locked up here.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_04_02
data.value: We need to break down these bars.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_05_01
data.value: God bless you! You are our saviors!

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_05_02
data.value: Is that all of you? Are there any more captives being held?

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_05_03
data.value: Not here in the base. But there’s a transport vessel with more prisoners loaded inside.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_05_04
data.value: You must save them!

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_05_05
data.value: Where can we find this transport?

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_05_06
data.value: It’s that large Reichist ship in the hangar.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_05_07
data.value: But the cargo bay was closed. We’ll have to hack the door control.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_06_01
data.value: Okay, the doors are open. Let’s free those captives.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_07_01
data.value: Thank god you came, I thought we would die here.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_07_02
data.value: Can any of you pilot that mothership?

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_07_03
data.value: No, but there’s a little mine where they keep pilots captive.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_07_04
data.value: Looks like we have to rescue the pilots too.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_08_02
data.value: We’re grateful for the rescue, but there are others inside the prison.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_08_03
data.value: Yes, we know, we saved them already.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_08_04
data.value: We need you to transport them from the prison to Fourth Reich mothership…

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_08_05
data.value: …and then get out of here.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_08_06
data.value: We’re just small-ship pilots. I don’t think any of us have ever flown something so large.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_08_07
data.value: I’m sure at least one of you can do it.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_08_08
data.value: Sure, piloting a mothership is not that different from piloting a fighter.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_08_09
data.value: I guess we don’t have any other choice.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_08_10
data.value: Guys, we have company.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_08_11
data.value: Go get the other prisoners, we’ll take care of these slavers.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_09_01
data.value: We’re ready, can you help us out? We need the hangar doors open.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_09_02
data.value: No problem.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_10_01
data.value: And off they go!

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_10_02
data.value: Wow, this is fantastic. I never thought I’d pilot something of this size.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_10_03
data.value: Thank you, my friends, we owe you one.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_10_04
data.value: I remember when I piloted a mothership for the first time.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_10_05
data.value: And was it “fantastic”?

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_10_06
data.value: Yeah. I crashed into the station after a few minutes.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_10_07
data.value: I thought you said piloting a mothership was easy?

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_10_08
data.value: I lied.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_10_09
data.value: So, what now? Are they all going to die?

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_10_10
data.value: No, I’m pretty sure everything on these new ships is automatic.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_10_11
data.value: …Pretty sure.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_11_01
data.value: Back to Cedric?

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase_11_02
data.value: Right away!

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0100
data.value: Here we are. Wow! They didn’t waste any time!

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0101
data.value: Epic! I’ve never seen anything like this.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0102
data.value: Hail, colleagues! Events transpired faster than we expected.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0103
data.value: As you can see, we are in the middle of a fight for Reway.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0104
data.value: What happened?

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0105
data.value: An EAC fleet guarding Reway was reported to be moving away…

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0106
data.value: …to handle some more important “issues”. This gave us an opportunity to attack immediately.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0107
data.value: We must be quick, otherwise there will be reinforcements.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0108
data.value: Do you have any assignments for us?

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0109
data.value: Or do we just sneak in, disable the base defenses, and free my brother?

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0110
data.value: That’s the plan. We have spec op forces assigned to liberate our prisoners

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0111
data.value: Get inside as fast as you can, free your brother, and get out of there!

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0112
data.value: You know this is the start of a war between EAC and FoR? Not just a rescue operation!

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0113
data.value: We realize that. Still, we prefer this to be a hit-and-run attack.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0114
data.value: We will deal with the main EAC fleet later.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0115
data.value: Let’s go. Marcus is waiting.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0200
data.value: Shit, that was close!

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0201
data.value: Keep moving, we’re almost there.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0300
data.value: You need to destroy the solar panels powering the security system…

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0301
data.value: …otherwise it’ll be impossible to get inside!

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0302
data.value: Almost done!

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0400
data.value: Apollo, critical update. EAC reinforcements just arrived. Three motherships.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0401
data.value: One of our zeppelins, Schwalbe, is in trouble. Its aiming system is barely functioning.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0402
data.value: We cannot send any forces right now; our fighters are all engaged. Can you help them out?

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0403
data.value: It won’t make life easier for us, but we’ll do what we can.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0404
data.value: Do you see that mothership, EAC Liberator?

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0405
data.value: Their defense headquarters are located there.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0406
data.value: We need you to destroy Liberator’s communication module!

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0407
data.value: Without Liberators’ lead, they’ll be lost!

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0408
data.value: That’s a suicide mission!

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0409
data.value: We’ll cover you.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0410
data.value: Thanks. Ok, let’s move!

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0500
data.value: That did the trick!

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0501
data.value: Great job. To all fighters: try to disengage and attack E.A.C. Liberator…

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0502
data.value: …repeat: try to disengage and attack… (white noise)

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0503
data.value: Let’s finish frying those solar panels.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0600
data.value: Security system disabled. Use the cargo bay to get inside the prison.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0601
data.value: And then?

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0602
data.value: Hey, boss, I thought you had a plan!

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0603
data.value: I do. We go in and Marcus comes out!

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0604
data.value: I found several security hubs inside. Try to hack them and find a database of prisoners.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0700
data.value: Authentication required – crap!

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0701
data.value: What kind of authentication?

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0702
data.value: I don’t know. Retinal scan? I don’t understand these new models.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0703
data.value: Let’s hope it uses normal ID cards. Find one.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0800
data.value: So it DOES use cards. Relax, Tarja, we don’t have to scoop out any EAC eyeballs.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0801
data.value: Oh, how thoughtful of you.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0802
data.value: Return to the hub and use the ID.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0803
data.value: We need to find out where Marcus is being held. Hurry, the battle won’t last much longer.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0900
data.value: Here’s the data. Marcus Rainier, sector B-2, cell 38.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0901
data.value: Perfect. You have to access the maintenance area; there’s no other way to the cells.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0902
data.value: Of course, the area is well guarded… surprise, surprise.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_0903
data.value: Just tell which direction to shoot in…

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1000
data.value: First, the easy work: use the hub to disconnect the generator.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1001
data.value: And then?

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1002
data.value: The usual stuff: shooting, dodging, maneuvering in narrow corridors…

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1100
data.value: Marcus has to be nearby. Can you see cell 38?

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1101
data.value: Found it!

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1200
data.value: Marcus! I was… we though you are dead!

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1201
data.value: Apollo? What are you doing here? Valentin! Tarja! You’ve all been caught?

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1202
data.value: Marcus, we need to get you out of here, fast!

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1203
data.value: How… Don’t tell me you stormed the prison and killed all the guards?

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1204
data.value: We had a little help from… “friends”. I’ll explain later.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1205
data.value: Madelyn, we have him!

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1206
data.value: Marcus! Are you all right?

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1207
data.value: You bastard! We thought you were dead!

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1208
data.value: Don’t worry; I’ll kill you the minute you set foot on my ship!

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1209
data.value: So good to hear your voice again, Madelyn.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1210
data.value: Shhh, we have company.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1300
data.value: Fly to the cargo bay, you have a chance to break through there!

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1400
data.value: Enemy spotted. In large quantities!

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1401
data.value: Engaging!

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1500
data.value: Move out! Fall back.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1501
data.value: What are THEY doing here?

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1502
data.value: I told you we brought “friends”.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1503
data.value: So while I was in prison the world turned inside out?

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1504
data.value: Madelyn, prepare to dock us.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1505
data.value: Sapho is ready to fly as soon as you’ve boarded. Marcus, prepare to die.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1506
data.value: I love happy endings!

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1507
data.value: If this were a real happy ending, all Fourth Reich ships would burn in hell…

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1510
data.value: Be nice to our new “friends”!

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1511
data.value: Sooner or later, you’ll be arrested too. Call this a practice run.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1600
data.value: Before you tell me the whole story, one question: Where are we going now?

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1601
data.value: EAC. The radar array at Silver Foresight.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1602
data.value: We need to place the final alien material detector there.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1603
data.value: Right. Guess it’s a long story. Let’s jump on Sapho and talk on the way.

data.name: Dlg_EACPrison_1604
data.value: And… nice to see you again, guys!

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_01_01
data.value: Welcome to Doppelburg, soldiers.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_01_02
data.value: Proceed to the hangar in tower A and wait until you are assigned to a squad.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_01_03
data.value: Affirmative, sir.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_02_01
data.value: Guten tag. What’s new in the Fatherland?

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_02_03
data.value: Have you been instructed as to the plan?

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_02_04
data.value: We have. If nothing has changed, we’re ready.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_02_05
data.value: No changes. There are three places you need to place explosives to weaken tower B…

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_02_06
data.value: …while we deal with tower A. After that, you’ll be paying a “visit” to the command center.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_03_01
data.value: This connects the command center to the main electrical network.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_03_02
data.value: Once you blow it up, they will have to switch to auxiliary batteries.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_03_03
data.value: It won’t stop them, but they won’t be able to keep all systems operational.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_03_04
data.value: It may save us from a few live turrets.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_04_01
data.value: It is always helpful to weaken enemy forces directly.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_04_02
data.value: Hide the bomb well here – we can destroy many of their fighters on the ground.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_05_01
data.value: A well-placed bomb here will help keep the command center offline.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_05_02
data.value: Shutting off the generator would be better…

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_05_03
data.value: …but it’s impossible without setting off an alarm.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_06_01
data.value: Excellent work, now prepare for the command center attack. I will be waiting nearby.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_06_02
data.value: You won’t be joining the attack?

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_06_03
data.value: No, my ship is equipped with a special hacking device.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_06_04
data.value: I’m carrying a virus that will take control of all the systems in Tower A at once.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_06_05
data.value: If I fail at that, it’s all over.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_06_06
data.value: And after all, there are three of you. That should be more than enough.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_06_07
data.value: So, we need to protect you until the virus is uploaded?

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_06_08
data.value: Exactly. Any complication can lead to a fatal failure.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_07_01
data.value: Get ready. Once you start shooting it’s you against whole enemy fleet.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_07_02
data.value: At least this masquerade will be over soon.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_07_03
data.value: You don’t like playing Nazi? Do I detect a conscience hiding in there?

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_08_01
data.value: Done, area clear. Now do your job.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_08_02
data.value: On my way. Meanwhile, get ready. Wolves coming soon.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_09_01
data.value: Hacking routine started. Approximate time remaining, 3 minutes.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_09_02
data.value: Can’t you do it faster?

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_09_03
data.value: Negative, I designed this software to have no weak point. It’s a lot of code.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_09_04
data.value: Glad to hear you’re that thorough.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_09_05
data.value: Thanks. It’s always nice to hear words of praise from one’s colleagues.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_09_06
data.value: Yeah. Nice.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_09_07
data.value: Our loyal friends will help protect us from outside attack.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_09_08
data.value: We only have to deal with forces inside the base.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_09_09
data.value: And we will.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_10_01
data.value: Another squad has started their engines.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_10_02
data.value: Wolves on their way.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_11_01
data.value: No! Someone’s interrupting the process!

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_11_02
data.value: Someone down there has a hacking computer of equal power and they’re blocking me.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_11_04
data.value: I thought you were the premier hacker in these parts?

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_11_05
data.value: This is no time for ego wars. Get him or we’re dead.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_11_06
data.value: Watch out for the turrets. Going straight down is suicide.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_11_07
data.value: The side tunnels?

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_11_08
data.value: I’ll follow you. Decide.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_12_01
data.value: You’re retired, pal!

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_12_02
data.value: Erhard, what’s your status?

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_12_03
data.value: Back online, advancing at a steady pace again.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_12_04
data.value: But another squadron’s coming. Get back here as fast as possible.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_12_05
data.value: There’s no end to them! I thought the Wolves were just a small faction.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_12_06
data.value: They have a lot of sympathizers. Even amongst everyday citizens.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_12_07
data.value: Guess you can’t shake off the 20th century just like that. Too bad.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_12_08
data.value: The path to perfection isn’t an easy one. But we are ready.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_12_09
data.value: Just be ready enough to not get killed right now.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_13_01
data.value: Done.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_13_02
data.value: Weapons will now pursue ships with White Wolf signatures.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_13_03
data.value: Excluding ours, of course.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_13_04
data.value: So, what now?

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_13_05
data.value: Now you need to disable both of the anti-mothership railguns in this tower.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_13_06
data.value: What? Didn’t you just do that?

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_13_07
data.value: Railguns have independent manual controls besides the remote ones.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_13_08
data.value: As long as there are Wolves around, they can seize control of them.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_13_09
data.value: And as long as the railguns are operational…

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_13_10
data.value: …we won’t get any support from Reich mother ships.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_13_11
data.value: Exactly.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_14_01
data.value: I destroyed everything that seemed like a control device for the railgun.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_14_02
data.value: According to my data, you did well. Now proceed to the next control room.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_14_03
data.value: Meanwhile I’m preparing a computer attack on Tower B.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_14_04
data.value: Proceeding.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_15_01
data.value: Done. Second railgun crippled.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_15_02
data.value: What next?

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_15_03
data.value: Move to Tower B. There is a service tunnel you can use. It shouldn’t be guarded.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_15_04
data.value: “Shouldn’t be”? How reassuring.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_15_05
data.value: By the way, where are all the loyal friends you were talking about?

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_15_06
data.value: According to the computer…

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_15_07
data.value: …three of their ships were destroyed outside the base while we took the command center.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_15_08
data.value: They fell for the cause.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_15_09
data.value: What? You say it as if you just dropped a candy bar.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_15_10
data.value: They were prepared to die. Just as I am. Just as you should be.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_15_11
data.value: I am not prepared to die here. I hate defeatist thinking.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_15_12
data.value: This mission was uncertain at best – all the way from beginning. We all knew it.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_16_01
data.value: I’m here, what now? Destroy some more railgun controls?

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_16_02
data.value: No, just shut down the generator. Then the railguns won’t have power.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_16_03
data.value: Why didn’t we do that in Tower A?

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_16_04
data.value: They’d have been able to reroute energy from other systems.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_16_05
data.value: But thanks to the work we’ve done, they won’t be able to do that in Tower B.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_16_06
data.value: Fine. Where do I go?

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_16_07
data.value: Up. To the reactor room. Destroy the cooling pipes leading to the generator.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_16_08
data.value: It will automatically shut down to prevent a meltdown.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_16_09
data.value: Sounds easy enough.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_16_10
data.value: Did you see the stationary weapons there? When we were placing the explosives.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_16_11
data.value: Yeah?

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_16_12
data.value: Are they still operational?

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_16_13
data.value: I guess we’ll see.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_17_01
data.value: Done. No energy, no railguns. Can we have the reinforcements now?

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_17_02
data.value: Signal sent. Proceed to the command center. There are still some things to be done.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_17_03
data.value: What exactly?

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_17_04
data.value: It’s impossible to hack any of the command center computers from outside.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_17_05
data.value: They have to be approached from inside.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_17_06
data.value: But don’t worry, it’s not as hard as what I did in Tower A.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_17_07
data.value: I just need to open a channel to Tower A. My virus will do the rest.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_17_08
data.value: Acknowledged.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_18_01
data.value: Great. The base is ours!

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_18_02
data.value: I have one last bit of unpleasant news for you.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_18_03
data.value: We are listening.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_18_04
data.value: The White Wolves had a mother ship stationed nearby. And now they are on their way here.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_18_05
data.value: What’s the plan?

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_18_06
data.value: Our forces will arrive ahead of them. But we would like your assistance during the fight.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_19_01
data.value: Apollo Rainier, join the assault squad.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_19_02
data.value: Your mission is to support our fighters during the dogfight…

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_19_03
data.value: …and then assist in neutralizing their zeppelin.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_19_04
data.value: Your targets are its main generators. Once they are out of commission, …

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_19_05
data.value: …it is just a matter of time till they surrender or we overtake their forces.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_19_06
data.value: Good luck!

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_19_07
data.value: Fight against a fully armed zeppelin? That does not sound… easy.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_19_08
data.value: It is possible. Just not easy.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_20_01
data.value: Excellent. Now proceed to destroy the backup batteries.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_20_02
data.value: Once that’s done, your job is over.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_21_01
data.value: To all White Wolf forces. It’s over. Surrender and we will spare your lives.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_21_02
data.value: Madelyn to Apollo! Report in.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_21_03
data.value: Apollo here. Madelyn, what are you doing here?

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_21_04
data.value: Von Stauffenberg sent me to pick you up directly. Let’s get out of here.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_21_05
data.value: You have no idea how glad I am to hear that.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_21_06
data.value: That goes for all of us.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_21_07
data.value: We’re meeting the Fourth Reich forces at Reway.

data.name: Dlg_TwinTowers_21_08
data.value: Walther convinced them to attack. Time to see Marcus again! Come on!

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1000
data.value: Welcome to Eurydice!

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1001
data.value: Amazing! The bending of the sun’s rays…

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1002
data.value: …through the Vandenberg Gas Field creates some spectacular visuals.

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1003
data.value: Yeah, looks like a sci-fi movie I once saw.

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1004
data.value: Guys, this is the plan: The parts we need are probably spread all over the place.

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1005
data.value: According to my blueprints, …

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1006
data.value: …there seems to be no one specific place containing probe parts.

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1007
data.value: We’re talking needle in a haystack?

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1008
data.value: Exactly!

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1009
data.value: So… random looting and pillaging! Awesome!

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1010
data.value: Just make sure you don’t blow up the parts we need.

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1011
data.value: I’ve uploaded you the dataprints from Reef.

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1012
data.value: Your HUD will detect which parts are relevant for us.

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1013
data.value: Incoming ships, identify yourself! This is a neutral research vessel on a mission…

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1014
data.value: …investigating the composition of the Vandenberg Gas Field.

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1015
data.value: Simply stated, you have something we want.

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1016
data.value: You could have tried to negotiate first!

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1017
data.value: We lean toward awkward silence and firearms.

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1018
data.value: Ok, you asked for it. All fighters, engage enemy!

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1019
data.value: This place looks pretty fortified.

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1020
data.value: There’s definitely something valuable inside.

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1021
data.value: Our missiles won’t do the job.

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1022
data.value: Yup, we need to hack in from somewhere.

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1023
data.value: This one won’t be easy.

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1024
data.value: Preliminary scans show you’ll need to unlock several seals in order to break through.

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1025
data.value: Wow, look at this!

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1026
data.value: The ship is built on an asteroid with rich helium deposits.

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1027
data.value: Technically, it runs on fuel from its own core.

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1028
data.value: Eh, science…

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1029
data.value: According to the dataprints, these are some of the parts we need.

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1030
data.value: Resonator, crystal receivers, and DIP switch.

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1031
data.value: Good!

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1032
data.value: Another bunch of goodies we need. Centrifugal switch, reed switch, and ultrasonic filters.

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1033
data.value: Great! We’ve got over half of the parts! Keep up the search!

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1034
data.value: Here comes Santa Claus! Sockets, wires, some biconical...

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1036
data.value: Sa-weet!

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1037
data.value: Sorry to say, but a few parts are still missing. Keep looking.

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1038
data.value: We’ve turned this whole place upside down. Any clues?

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1039
data.value: Hey, remember that shielded hi-tech container we found? Now that we’ve hacked a few hubs…

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1040
data.value: Good point. Maybe it’s open.

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1041
data.value: Yes! The force field’s down, we’re free to enter.

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1042
data.value: All right! Solenoids, hmm, filter capacitators…

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1043
data.value: …OS-CON polymer capacitators, rectifier tubes, and klystrons.

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1044
data.value: Checking the list and… we’re good!

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1045
data.value: Ok, guys, come back to Sapho and we’ll set a course out of here!

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1046
data.value: What’s the next stop?

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1047
data.value: We need to hit the black market for those fuel cells.

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1048
data.value: Manjeet is our man.

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1049
data.value: Right. To the Junkyard, Jeeves.

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1050
data.value: This computer over here, might it be helpful?

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1051
data.value: You never know. Apollo, you have the hacking device, would you mind…?

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1052
data.value: My pleasure.

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1053
data.value: This seems like another computer or security hub.

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1054
data.value: Check it out.

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1055
data.value: I’ve got another security hub. Apollo?

data.name: Dlg_ResearchVessel_1056
data.value: On my way.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseEscape_1000
data.value: We’re near the rendezvous point with Madelyn.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseEscape_1001
data.value: Red guards to cargo transport GA7. Enemy detected. EAC mother ship.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseEscape_1002
data.value: Provide cover fire and we will engage and destroy. Do you copy?

data.name: Dlg_ChineseEscape_1003
data.value: What should we do? We can’t answer. They’ll know right away we’re not Chinese.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseEscape_1004
data.value: I’ve got a back-up plan.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseEscape_1005
data.value: This may get ugly.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseEscape_1006
data.value: The worst that can happen is they destroy their own ship.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseEscape_1007
data.value: Remember, our fighters are still docked inside.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseEscape_1008
data.value: Right, but all the plutonium will be lost.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseEscape_1009
data.value: All the more reason to give it our best shot.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseEscape_1010
data.value: GA7. This is your last warning. Respond or prepare for take-over.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseEscape_1011
data.value: Get ready.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseEscape_1012
data.value: Red Guards, disable GA7 engines and assume control of ship.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseEscape_1013
data.value: Fire!

data.name: Dlg_ChineseEscape_1014
data.value: Disable your weapons and engines and we will let you live!

data.name: Dlg_ChineseEscape_1015
data.value: Bu hao, pal, bu hao. We’re taking this dandy load of plutonium with us.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseEscape_1016
data.value: Then prepare for larger engagement

data.name: Dlg_ChineseEscape_1017
data.value: We have called for reinforcements from a nearby outpost base.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseEscape_1018
data.value: Only a fool provokes the Chinese army!

data.name: Dlg_ChineseEscape_1019
data.value: Damn it!

data.name: Dlg_ChineseEscape_1020
data.value: Steady, bro. We take care of these guys…

data.name: Dlg_ChineseEscape_1021
data.value: …and hope to get to Madelyn before their reinforcements arrive.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseEscape_1022
data.value: Just to review… You were supposed to open fire after I got into battle range.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseEscape_1023
data.value: Shit happens.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseEscape_1024
data.value: Copy that. Let’s finish them off together and get back to Manjeet.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseEscape_1025
data.value: Right. I’m sick of this turret cockpit. I feel the need to MOVE.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseEscape_1026
data.value: Enemies destroyed. We’re clear to proceed.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseEscape_1027
data.value: I’ll tell Manjeet we’re on our way. Next stop, the Junkyard Hilton.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0100
data.value: Seems we’re not alone. I’m detecting fighters. Lots of them.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0101
data.value: We’ll check it out.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0102
data.value: There’s a battle raging here, fire and gunshots all around.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0103
data.value: What the hell is that?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0104
data.value: EAC Battleship, armed and operational.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0105
data.value: What is EAC doing around here?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0106
data.value: All troops, withdraw! Repeat, withdraw! EAC forces incoming!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0107
data.value: Seems they’re afraid of us.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0108
data.value: Guys, get to Thomas quickly. I’m only getting a weak signal of his ship. Find him ASAP.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0109
data.value: Roger that.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0200
data.value: Eat my steel, you filthy schlingels – ah, wait, Apollo? Is that you?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0201
data.value: Glad to see you at full strength, Thomas!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0202
data.value: Those raiders gave me an adrenaline rush.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0203
data.value: I feel like a kid in my fifties again!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0204
data.value: What happened here?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0205
data.value: They came out of nowhere. Probably some raiding group that wanted equipment and cash.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0206
data.value: They weren’t interested in me, just my loot.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0207
data.value: Sorry for interrupting, guys, but there are still fighters inside the base.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0208
data.value: Maybe you could, ah… you know…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0209
data.value: Fight them?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0210
data.value: That would be nice.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0300
data.value: Good job, guys! Bad news, though – the raiders seem to be regrouping for a bigger strike.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0301
data.value: I’m picking up several large ships as well.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0302
data.value: I have some defense turrets in storage.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0303
data.value: I didn’t have time to place them; the raiders took me by surprise.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0304
data.value: If you install them you can beef up our defenses.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0305
data.value: Shouldn’t we just hit the raiders while they’re regrouping?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0306
data.value: Negative. Better to fortify the base and crush them at our gates.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0307
data.value: They won’t be expecting stationary defenses.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0308
data.value: Good point.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0309
data.value: Apollo, would you mind taking charge of placing those turrets?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0310
data.value: And be quick, those raiders won’t take long to regroup.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0311
data.value: I’ll do my best.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0400
data.value: Enemy incoming. First wave of fighters.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0401
data.value: We’re ready.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0402
data.value: This group looks too easy.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0403
data.value: There are two mother ships on the horizon. Try to avoid taking damage.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0404
data.value: And keep an eye on Thomas.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0500
data.value: Good job, everyone!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0501
data.value: You do know there’s another wave approaching? Just saying.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0502
data.value: We’re always well-prepared.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0503
data.value: That’s what they say about duck l’orange.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0600
data.value: We have a birthday surprise for you! Kabooom – (laughter) he, he!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0601
data.value: Oh my God, this is not good!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0602
data.value: What’s that?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0603
data.value: Demolition ships.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0604
data.value: Cargo freighters packed with explosives on a collision course with… Sapho.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0605
data.value: Ok, Priority One: Everyone, target those suicide ships!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0606
data.value: Just so you know, if one of those even grazes me…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0607
data.value: …Sapho will turn into a pile of space debris.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0608
data.value: More like space vapor. I’ve seen these things before.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0609
data.value: My strong advice: look, but don’t touch.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0610
data.value: We’ll handle it. Madelyn, don’t worry.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0700
data.value: Good job, guys! Keep it up!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0800
data.value: We have a minute to catch our breath before the final battle.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0801
data.value: Mother ships approaching.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0802
data.value: Use what time you have to repair those turrets.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0803
data.value: There’s plenty of maintenance equipment around my base.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0804
data.value: Let’s get to it.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0805
data.value: Don’t get too immersed. Make a few quick repairs, then get ready for the attack!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0900
data.value: Concentrate on their weapons and generators.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_0901
data.value: We can’t crush their armor, we can only target their weak spots.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1000
data.value: Splendid operation!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1001
data.value: Seems like ol’ Thomas enjoyed the thrill.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1002
data.value: Good job, guys!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1003
data.value: Now, I will spend some time on repairs, but thanks for the help!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1004
data.value: You’re welcome.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1005
data.value: By the way, how did you know about this raider attack?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1006
data.value: We didn’t. We came seeking your assistance.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1007
data.value: We’re ready to construct those alien material detectors.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1008
data.value: Excellent!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1009
data.value: Francis Reef designed them and gave us the blueprints.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1010
data.value: We have all the components we need, and the fuel.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1011
data.value: Hm, are you ready to deploy them?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1012
data.value: We need to build them first. We thought we could do it here.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1013
data.value: I don’t have the equipment and tools for that kind of job.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1014
data.value: You do! Remember the stuff we picked at Broken Moon?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1015
data.value: I was checking the list and according to specs from Reef…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1016
data.value: …it is possible to build a simple manufacturing plant here.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1017
data.value: Seems you’re a step ahead of me. Then go right for it!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1018
data.value: Pick up the tools you need in the cargo storage and build your plant.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1019
data.value: I can’t wait to see the results.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1020
data.value: Give us a little time and a brand new manufacturing…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1021
data.value: …plant will be standing right by your door!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1022
data.value: Superb!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1100
data.value: Ready to boogie! This “plant” should be able to build the detectors!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1101
data.value: I take it Reef carefully instructed you as to the process?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1102
data.value: We… hope so.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1200
data.value: That… was fast!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1201
data.value: You are already done?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1202
data.value: It was just a matter of assembly and connection.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1203
data.value: Remember, we already had all the chips and stuff.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1204
data.value: Great! Now that you have the detectors…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1205
data.value: …you need to place them in order to create the triangulation necessary.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1206
data.value: What can we expect to find, anyway? Any “guesstimates”?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1207
data.value: The detectors should give you nearly precise locations of all items…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1208
data.value: …across the inner solar system made of this alien material.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1209
data.value: Random thought. If one of the artifacts was with the Russians…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1210
data.value: …would it point to their base or mother ship as well?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1211
data.value: Exactly! Well, unless the artifacts were heavily shielded.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1212
data.value: I understand. So now we just need to find some good locations for placing the detectors?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1213
data.value: I suggest we place them in free space…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1214
data.value: …somewhere outside the territories occupied by someone.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1215
data.value: You can’t place those things in open space.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1216
data.value: What?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1217
data.value: They won’t work for long distances.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1218
data.value: But I thought that was why we got the rare plutonium isotopes!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1219
data.value: Even with the super plutonium, you still need to place the detectors in…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1220
data.value: …existing long-range radar fields.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1221
data.value: Consider them extenders only. You need to overtake three radar…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1222
data.value: …operations across the Solar system and attach those detectors to them!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1223
data.value: Overtake?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1224
data.value: Ok, listen. I’ve already scouted some suitable locations. Chinese radar array at…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1225
data.value: …Yunzun, Russian array at Tver, and EAC radar array at Silver Foresight.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1226
data.value: You must mask your attack as a pirate raid. Rush inside, destroy some equipment and…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1227
data.value: …while some of you are looting, one of you will sneak into the command center…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1228
data.value: …and attach the detector to the cables for the radar dishes.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1229
data.value: Make sure it looks like a raid, so the device stays attached and online long enough…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1230
data.value: …to complete the two remaining missions.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1231
data.value: Remember, we need triangulation, that is three detectors active at the same time.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1232
data.value: Understand?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1233
data.value: No, but I’m hoping YOU do.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1234
data.value: I do. This is the easiest and most functional way to do it.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1235
data.value: Ok, let’s get this over with. Madelyn?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1236
data.value: Ready for Yunzun?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1237
data.value: China, here we come!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonPlant_1238
data.value: We’ll brush up on our Kung-fu on the way!

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_01_01
data.value: Changde. I hear this place is a tall stack of laughs.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_01_02
data.value: Before taking over the cargo transport, you must disable the transmitter.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_01_03
data.value: Otherwise the base will send a warning to the refinery.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_01_04
data.value: To do this, you need two security codes from the two different asteroid stations.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_01_05
data.value: Me and Tarja will go after the distant one.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_01_06
data.value: Apollo, you and Valentin get the security code from the other base.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_01_07
data.value: Roger that.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_02_01
data.value: Security code acquired.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_02_02
data.value: Good. Get outside the station and meet us on the way to the transmitter.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_02_03
data.value: Acknowledged.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_03_01
data.value: Damn! They’re shooting at me!

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_04_01
data.value: Another bunch of red guards!

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_04_02
data.value: Marcus, I may be running a little late.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_04_03
data.value: Fine, I’ll take care of my own business and wait for you.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_05_01
data.value: We need to get rid of all the guards to get inside!

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_06_01
data.value: I’ll go take care of the transport ship.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_06_02
data.value: Tarja, Valentin, Apollo –

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_06_03
data.value: – you deactivate the security terminals and destroy the transmitter.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_07_01
data.value: Your turn, Apollo. Disable those two terminals.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_08_01
data.value: Done. Now I’ll go place the bomb on the transmitter.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_09_01
data.value: Placed. Everyone, quick, get to a safe distance!

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_11_01
data.value: We’re almost good to go. I got the transporter.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_11_02
data.value: Again, Apollo, Tarja, Valentin.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_11_03
data.value: You need to get an entrance code from the transport control.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_11_04
data.value: On our way, boss.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_12_01
data.value: I’ve heard a lot about this place. They say over 40% of all plutonium ore comes from here.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_12_02
data.value: And dozens of miners die here every day, thanks to poor safety measures.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_12_03
data.value: They choose this way of life.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_12_04
data.value: The conditions may be inhuman, but the workers aren’t slaves.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_12_05
data.value: They’re free to leave anytime they want.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_12_06
data.value: They need cash. And many of them can’t leave because of their families.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_13_01
data.value: Take out those guards!

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_14_01
data.value: Damn, the door is locked! We need to find some other way.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_15_01
data.value: Hah! I found another way.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_16_01
data.value: Ok, this is the computer that has the entry code!

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_17_01
data.value: Apollo, what’s your status?

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_17_02
data.value: We just got the code.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_17_03
data.value: Good! Hurry up then. I’ve got a welcoming committee here.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_18_01
data.value: Guys, help me get rid of these enemy fighters so we can roll!

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_19_01
data.value: EAC agents! We will crush you!

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_19_02
data.value: Gosh, I love these Chinese special forces.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_20_01
data.value: Area clear. Docking in, I’m ready to depart for Jingzhou.

data.name: Dlg_ChineseTransport_20_03
data.value: Excellent! You know the plan, I am wishing you best of luck!

data.name: Dlg_EACSurveySite_0711
data.value: There are lot miners near you. Go help them.

data.name: Dlg_SlaverBase2_08_06
data.value: Here are their coordinates downloaded from hub.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0100
data.value: Fort Valiant, here we come.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0101
data.value: I hope Captain Cedric has some good news for us.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0102
data.value: Marcus Rainier to Captain Cedric.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0103
data.value: Hail!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0104
data.value: We’ve returned. The second Slavers operation was successful.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0105
data.value: I’ve gone through the reports you sent. Good work, again!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0106
data.value: I will transfer you the financial reward. Are you ready for another assignment?

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0107
data.value: Maybe later, first…

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0108
data.value: …the audience with patriarchs. Do you have any news for us?

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0109
data.value: Indeed! The patriarchs are willing to give you an audience.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0110
data.value: Proceed to the Chamber of the Council.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0200
data.value: Hail there! You have permission to pass into the Council Chambers…

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0201
data.value: …the patriarchs await you!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0300
data.value: You are clear to proceed.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0301
data.value: May the Council’s advice bring you the blessings you seek on your journey!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0400
data.value: Welcome. May the audience begin. Speak your Truth!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0401
data.value: We seek an artifact. An alien artifact. Remains of an ancient civilization.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0402
data.value: We have reason to believe you have come in contact with it.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0403
data.value: We would be grateful for any leads that might help us find it.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0404
data.value: We have no idea what you are talking about.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0405
data.value: We neither know about any artifact you call “alien”…

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0406
data.value: …nor do we believe in the existence of such.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0407
data.value: I don’t believe a word he’s saying.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0408
data.value: Me either, but there’s nothing we can do about it now.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0409
data.value: Let’s get our equipment back and head back to Sapho.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0410
data.value: Are there any other matters you wish to discuss?

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0411
data.value: No. We’re good. You’ve been incredibly… (un)helpful.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0412
data.value: This audience is over. May God be with you.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0500
data.value: I have information you seek. If you wish to know more, proceed to these coordinates.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0501
data.value: That’s weird. What should we do?

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0502
data.value: Let’s check it out. We have nothing to lose, right?

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0503
data.value: Except body parts, vital organs… Like always.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0600
data.value: Psst, over there.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0601
data.value: Are you talking to us, Templar?

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0602
data.value: I know what you came for, what you yearn for, and what you were unrighteously denied.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0603
data.value: I know about the lies upon lies perpetrated by our patriarchs…

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0604
data.value: Can we cut to the–

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0605
data.value: Let him talk.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0606
data.value: You came for the artifact. The one our Order holds in secret.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0607
data.value: What do you know about it? And why are you telling us all this?

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0608
data.value: Please continue, sir…?

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0609
data.value: Geraint, that’s my Order name.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0610
data.value: I was the leader of the expedition that discovered this inhuman artifact.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0611
data.value: Our Order deemed it to be heretical, cursed by diabolical powers.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0612
data.value: The patriarchs ordered it to be kept in secret – even from our fellow brothers.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0613
data.value: It is not being studied, nor is anyone else making use of it.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0614
data.value: But… I… I joined the Order to search for Truth, not for lies and concealment…

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0615
data.value: So, you wish to aid us, noble sir?

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0616
data.value: I want this artifact to be studied. I have heard of some your deeds…

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0617
data.value: …and I am convinced you will make better use of it than we are.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0618
data.value: My intuition was right. That’s where they’re keeping the artifact!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0619
data.value: Can you give us specific directions?

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0620
data.value: I marked the location and the forgotten secret path on your GPS.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0621
data.value: Take this equipment first, you will need it!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0622
data.value: I suggest only one of you undertake this mission.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0623
data.value: The underground has been – what is your word? – booby-trapped.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0624
data.value: A single person might more easily avoid its pitfalls.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0626
data.value: Got it. I’ll go.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0627
data.value: May Providence be with you!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0628
data.value: Many thanks, sir!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0700
data.value: Ready to roll!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0701
data.value: Good luck, Apollo!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0800
data.value: Hm, the path seems to go through this broken vent.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_0900
data.value: I can’t avoid this security field. There must be a computer controlling it.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_1000
data.value: Path clear!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_1200
data.value: Security sensors. Need to avoid them!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_1300
data.value: This sensor looks like a tricky one!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_1400
data.value: Looks like the treasure cache! Radiated – damn!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_1401
data.value: Relics, some old remains… Fascinating!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_1402
data.value: Got to find the artifact, fast. Hope my computer is able to identify it.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_1500
data.value: The artifact must be in one of those concrete blocks.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_1501
data.value: Gotta be careful not to destroy it. Drilling should be safe…

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_1600
data.value: According to the computer – this is it! Excellent!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_1601
data.value: Better get back.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_1700
data.value: Damn! I hate these security fields…

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_1701
data.value: Gotta find a way to get rid of them – or find the computer that controls them.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_1800
data.value: Looks like the guards left this room open.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_1900
data.value: This computer might help me get out of here!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2000
data.value: Hm, there seems to be another way out!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2101
data.value: Now, let’s get the hell out of here!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2201
data.value: Crap. Dead end. There must be another way out.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2300
data.value: Hmm, a possible exit. Maybe it’s time to ask Sir Geraint for some hints.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2301
data.value: Sir Geraint? I reached a dead end.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2302
data.value: Either the tunnels are impassable or they’re guarded by scanner.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2303
data.value: You’re almost there. I will send you new GPS coordinates…

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2304
data.value: …a path through the catacombs to the main temple.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2305
data.value: I will wait for you on the surface, together with your friends.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2400
data.value: That was tons of fun.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2401
data.value: Success?

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2402
data.value: Success! I have the artifact.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2403
data.value: Glad you made it and found the object you seek! I wish you blessings on your journey!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2404
data.value: Apollo, grab the equipment you left before the meeting with the Council.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2405
data.value: Then get ready for departure.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2406
data.value: Departure where?

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2407
data.value: Rime.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2408
data.value: Get your equipment back, we can talk on the way there.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2500
data.value: Your audience took quite some time. Is everything settled to you satisfaction?

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2501
data.value: Yes, brother, we got the answers we pursued.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2502
data.value: Excellent!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2600
data.value: So… what’s the plan?

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2601
data.value: Thomas came up with a plan for constructing an alien artifact detector.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2602
data.value: Using the pieces we already have…

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2603
data.value: …we should have enough information to create a long-range detector.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2604
data.value: It’ll allow us to locate other artifact parts scattered through the solar system.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2605
data.value: Why are we going to Rime?

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2606
data.value: You need two things: a brilliant technician and hi-end components.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2607
data.value: I have references on a guy, Francis Reef, …

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2608
data.value: …supposedly one of the best R&D people at OmniCorp Technologies.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2609
data.value: I don’t know him personally, but my contacts say he’s a genius.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2610
data.value: Can’t you make the device yourself? With our help?

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2611
data.value: Nah, this is way beyond my abilities. I came up with the concept…

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2612
data.value: …but you need someone who can technically pull it off.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2613
data.value: Remember, we’re dealing with unknown substances and extremely long-range scanners.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2614
data.value: Understood.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2615
data.value: One more thing. The first artifact. Did you find it useful?

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2616
data.value: In a sense… Nothing we can utilize in a pragmatic sense of the word.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2617
data.value: More of… pointer toward greater discovery.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2618
data.value: Meaning?

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2619
data.value: At the moment, I have nothing more to say. Drop the Valiant artifact at my place.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2620
data.value: I will see whether I can find out anything more.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2621
data.value: That alien material detector should point us further.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2622
data.value: In other words, thanks to the artifact we can create a detector to search for…

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2623
data.value: …other artifacts. Glad to have been so useful!

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2625
data.value: Valentin, this work is important. Those Russians want those artifacts badly.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2626
data.value: They must have some reason – political or military – not just curiosity.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2627
data.value: Okay, understood.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2628
data.value: Ready to head for Rime, guys?

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2629
data.value: It’s Rime time. Set the course. I’ll take the artifact to Barth again and meet you there.

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2630
data.value: Don’t start anything without me, understood?

data.name: Dlg_FortValiantC_2631
data.value: You’re the boss!

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0100
data.value: Here we are. According to the triangulation, …

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0101
data.value: …the source of the signal is somewhere nearby.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0102
data.value: How precise are the scans?

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0103
data.value: Plus or minus a few hundred kilometers, I’d say.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0104
data.value: I can live with that.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0200
data.value: Enemy ships on radar! What are they doing here?

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0201
data.value: Take them down! Quick.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0300
data.value: I don’t like this; we’d better be careful.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0301
data.value: Continue searching, but stay on high alert.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0400
data.value: Guys, let’s try a new spot. I transmitted each of you some coordinates to check.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0401
data.value: Affirmative.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0402
data.value: Got it.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0403
data.value: Roger that.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0404
data.value: I’ll keep scanning the area from afar.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0500
data.value: Sorry to disturb you, guys, but I’ve got ships incoming.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0501
data.value: I’m picking a signal… it’s…

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0502
data.value: How nice to see you again, my… friends!

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0503
data.value: Damn it. Two Russian motherships are approaching, too.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0504
data.value: What is this, a family reunion?

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0505
data.value: What are you doing here? And what’s with your new Russian buddies?

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0506
data.value: Perhaps we were just in the neighborhood and your behavior piqued our curiosity.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0507
data.value: Spit it out, Francis. What are you up to?

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0508
data.value: Tracking device. On your mother ship.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0509
data.value: I’ve been following you for quite some time.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0510
data.value: After all, business is business.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0511
data.value: How much did they offer you?

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0512
data.value: Come on, how much?

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0513
data.value: Let’s just say I could buy half of Rime with the deposit alone.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0514
data.value: Nonsense, the Russians don’t have that kind of cash.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0515
data.value: You’d be surprised. Russians in general might be poor, …

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0516
data.value: …but the people we are dealing with… not so.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0517
data.value: And it’s not just Russian money in all this.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0518
data.value: Well, I’m glad you’ll be able to afford a top-notch funeral.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0519
data.value: While you won’t be, Mr. Rainier. Sorry to see your heroic story end here.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0520
data.value: Soon, no one will remember you.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0521
data.value: I, on the other hand, represent the present and the future!

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0522
data.value: What else did they offer you?

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0523
data.value: Do you know who you are speaking to?

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0524
data.value: Assistant Director of Research and Development at Rime, OmniCorp.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0525
data.value: Career advancement?

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0526
data.value: My heart and soul are the same color as yours. Like you, I want money, I want recognition…

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0527
data.value: …and I want to be the first human to set eyes on what our predecessors built here.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0528
data.value: I must admit, he’s right about that. We do want the same.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0529
data.value: True. He is a traitor and I want him dead. But I do understand his motives.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0530
data.value: Why did you join with the Russians? Wouldn’t you have been in a better position with us?

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0531
data.value: I was… considering that, Mr. Rainier.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0532
data.value: But the Russians have… well… Much more than you could ever imagine.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0533
data.value: They’ll use you and kill you as soon as they’re finished here.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0534
data.value: I don’t see that happening.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0535
data.value: You see, I have access to technology you and they can only dream of…

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0536
data.value: …at least for the few next years.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0537
data.value: Without me, they can’t take one step toward analyzing and reproducing those alien devices.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0538
data.value: Reproducing?

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0539
data.value: You really think we are archeologists, young Mr. Rainier?

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0540
data.value: They’ve got top engineers and scientists of their own. Loyal ones, too.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0541
data.value: Not traitors. I’m surprised you fell for their fairy tale;

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0542
data.value: I thought you were smarter than that.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0543
data.value: We’ve talked enough. I wish you swift death, no pain. Let us resolve this once and for all

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0544
data.value: Fine. Not the end I hoped for, but at least we’ll enjoy the sweet taste of revenge.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0545
data.value: Men, women, do your best.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0546
data.value: We won’t have another chance. Make it final.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0547
data.value: Marcus, just a side note. We have one mother ship and four fighters…

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0548
data.value: …and they have three mother ships and probably dozens of fighters…

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0549
data.value: I assume you have a plan?

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0550
data.value: Yes… Improvise!

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0600
data.value: Go, go, go!!!

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0601
data.value: Use the asteroids as cover. Guerilla warfare.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0602
data.value: Madelyn, avoid direct fire and get out of here.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0603
data.value: We can do this!

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0604
data.value: Shoot that mother ship down!

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0700
data.value: Madelyn, are you ok?

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0800
data.value: That was close but I’m fine.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0801
data.value: I’ll regroup with you in a couple of minutes to give you some fire support.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0802
data.value: This position isn’t safe. Enemy ships will be here in no time.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0803
data.value: Let’s meet at these new coordinates. Be the hunter, not the prey.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0804
data.value: I’ll be there soon.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0805
data.value: Enemy ships incoming, let’s hurry.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0900
data.value: Here she comes, at last!

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0901
data.value: Looks like we’re safe for the moment. Did you guys come up with a plan?

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0902
data.value: Those Russian battleships are heavily fortified.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0903
data.value: There’s no way we could charge them and survive.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0904
data.value: Let’s use the size and speed of your ships to our advantage.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0905
data.value: Their guns are big, but can’t easily target a small object.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0906
data.value: I notice their ships are heavily armored on the side, but not the back.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0907
data.value: We can duck behind asteroids and strike them from behind.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0908
data.value: I’ll just avoid their mother ships and give you support fire against their fighters.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0909
data.value: We can do this if we focus on their vital systems.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0910
data.value: This is the fight of our lives, guys. We either die now or remember this battle forever.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0911
data.value: Apollo, Tarja, Valentyn, come with me. We’ll start with the mothership on the right wing.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0912
data.value: Madelyn – hold off their fighters till we’re done.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_0913
data.value: Affirmative!

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_1000
data.value: They are trying to outflank us, shoot them down!

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_1001
data.value: We need to take cover behind the asteroids, there are too many rocket turrets.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_1002
data.value: Enemy fighters approaching!

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_1003
data.value: We have to stay behind asteroids no matter what.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_1100
data.value: We made it!

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_1200
data.value: They’ve boarded the ship. Fighters, engage the threat! Top priority!

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_1201
data.value: Now comes the hardest part. We have to destroy the ship from inside.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_1202
data.value: Overcharging the generators should do the job and buy us some time to leave the ship.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_1203
data.value: We have to start with the power generator.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_1204
data.value: Then we’ll sabotage the protective devices on the core engine.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_1300
data.value: Great job, quickly overcharge it and get out.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_1301
data.value: On our way!

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_1302
data.value: The core should be located in the upper floors of the ship.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_1400
data.value: We have to get out as soon as possible after we sabotage this one.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_1500
data.value: The core is highly unstable; we have about 40 seconds to get out.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_1501
data.value: No sightseeing on the way then.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_1502
data.value: Just go!!

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_1600
data.value: Well, that was close.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_1601
data.value: Quick, get to Madelyn. The Russian ships are going to be here soon.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_1700
data.value: Apollo, make sure to stop by here at Sapho to refuel and have your ship repaired!

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_1701
data.value: I think I still have some spare equipment and ammunition.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_1702
data.value: Now let’s move on to the second Russian mothership.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_1703
data.value: They’re going to be prepared this time; this won’t be as easy as the first one.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_1704
data.value: Let’s just do it!

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_1800
data.value: Enemy approaching…

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_1900
data.value: Quickly, get in, there are no asteroids to cover us.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_2000
data.value: Guys you know what to do, so let’s get this done.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_2001
data.value: Affirmative!

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_2200
data.value: What is this? Armored doors?

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_2201
data.value: They’re as tough as the walls of the ship!

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_2202
data.value: You’ve got to find a way through. There has to be a control room somewhere.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_2203
data.value: Follow me.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_2300
data.value: Check the hub systems!

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_2301
data.value: Got it, the door should be open now!

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_2400
data.value: What is this? Madelyn, any ideas?

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_2401
data.value: It looks like a laboratory. It must be where they study the alien technology.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_2402
data.value: It might be wise to get all their data, before we blow this whole thing up.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_2403
data.value: Workin’ on it.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_2500
data.value: Ok, let’s go. Any interesting findings?

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_2501
data.value: I don’t have time to go through all the data right now. But it looks…

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_2502
data.value: …promising. We’ll discuss it with Thomas later.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_2600
data.value: Go, go, go!

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_2601
data.value: Enemy interceptors again!

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_2602
data.value: Never mind, there’s no time for fighting. Get out now!

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_2700
data.value: Great job! You’ve done it, guys.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_2701
data.value: What? How?

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_2702
data.value: Now let’s hunt down Reef once and for all.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_2703
data.value: Any more… precise plan?

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_2704
data.value: Cut off his weapons and generators. That should do the trick.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_2705
data.value: Confirmed.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_2800
data.value: This is not the last time we will meet.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_2801
data.value: Quick, stop him, he’s about to take off.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_2802
data.value: He’s too fast. Madelyn, block his way quick!

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_2803
data.value: I’m trying!

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_2900
data.value: What the hell…!

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_2901
data.value: Nice! You got him.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_3000
data.value: Quickly, shoot the pursuers down!!!

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_3200
data.value: Did you get him?

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_3201
data.value: Of course we did… Where have you been?

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_3202
data.value: I found something; you’re not going to believe this. Get in here, quick.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_3300
data.value: Oh my God!

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_3301
data.value: So this is the source of the signal.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_3302
data.value: I must admit I wasn’t expecting something quite so… holy crap.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_3303
data.value: This is the moment I’ve waited for my entire life.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_3304
data.value: Any idea what it is?

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_3305
data.value: A door. To another world. A wormhole generator, a gateway device…

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_3306
data.value: Can we… use it?

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_3307
data.value: It does not seem operational at the moment.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_3308
data.value: If we find a way to make it operational, it will take us –

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_3309
data.value: To its other side.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_3310
data.value: Another galaxy… or maybe even another universe with its own laws of physics.

data.name: Dlg_AlienGate_3311
data.value: So what do we do?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0101
data.value: I can’t remember ever being this far from the Sun.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0108
data.value: Ehm. So, Madelyn, are we close?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0110
data.value: According to my scans, there is a small base deeper in the asteroid field…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0111
data.value: I marked it on your GPS.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0112
data.value: On our way.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0113
data.value: Who is this Barth, again?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0114
data.value: He was one of my professors back at Greenbelt…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0115
data.value: Thomas Barth, a brilliant anthropologist from the old days…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0116
data.value: Sounds like he taught you more than anthropology.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0117
data.value: Marcus!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0118
data.value: Please go on, Madelyn. Any idea where we might find him?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0119
data.value: He was always this kind of crazy scientist guy…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0120
data.value: The last time I saw him was before he left on his “hermitage”.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0121
data.value: Hermitage?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0122
data.value: This guy REALLY doesn’t like neighbors.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0201
data.value: This place looks kinda romantic even to me.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0301
data.value: Greetings!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0302
data.value: Welcome, travelers! Make yourselves at home.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0304
data.value: Are you Thomas Barth?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0305
data.value: – He is. –

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0306
data.value: I am.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0307
data.value: What brings you to these lands? Exploration? Adventure?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0308
data.value: Thomas, remember me? Madelyn Lloyd…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0309
data.value: I was in your graduate anthropology class at Greenbelt.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0310
data.value: Fraulein! How could I forget…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0311
data.value: I always knew we would meet again! It was destiny.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0312
data.value: Actually, Barth, we came to see you.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0313
data.value: A Russian paramilitary group searching for something they call “alien artifacts”…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0314
data.value: …has your name on its list.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0315
data.value: Any idea what they may be up to?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0316
data.value: Is this so?

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0317
data.value: I’ll show you all the data we found. That will explain everything.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0318
data.value: My observations were correct! E-everyone – everyone thought…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0319
data.value: I was a madman, ranting about alien relics.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0320
data.value: Now, fate has brought you here to be my… apostles!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0321
data.value: Let’s not get carried away.

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0322
data.value: I – I never thought of you as a madman, Thomas!

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0323
data.value: I know. But most of the others did. That’s why I had to leave Greenbelt…

data.name: Dlg_BarthsMoonConvince_0324
